title: Absolute Texxas
descriptionSnippet: Absolute Texxas is dedicated to developing men and women based upon the principles of individual leadership, personal integrity, and teamwork. We are committed to fostering life-long friendships and personal development that will enrich our lives and c...
fullDescription: Absolute Texxas is dedicated to developing men and women based upon the principles of individual leadership, personal integrity, and teamwork. We are committed to fostering life-long friendships and personal development that will enrich our lives and craft a truly lifelong Absolute Texxas experience.if you are interested in joining us and would like more information, please like us on Facebook!
twitterDescription: A co-ed student organization at The University of Texas at Austin with three core values: Leadership, Teamwork, and Integrity.

title: African American Male Research Initiative
descriptionSnippet: The main goals of The University of Texas at Austin African American Male Research Initiative (AAMRI) are to increase and increase the number of African American males attending graduate and professional schools.
fullDescription: The main goals of The University of Texas at Austin African American Male Research Initiative (AAMRI) are to increase the four-year graduation rate of African American males at UT Austin and increase the number of African American males attending graduate and professional schools. The initiative also works to increase the number of African American Males attending four-year colleges and universities across the state of Texas.
twitterDescription: AAMRI works to provide holistic development to our young Black men through personal, psychological, financial, global, and professional resources.

title: African Students Organization
descriptionSnippet: ASO is a social organization committed to promoting African culture on the UT campus and surrounding community through dance, music, poetry and more. At meetings, we actively focus on educating everyone on issues that affect Africans and Africa.
fullDescription: ASO is dedicated to form links between African Students on the UT campus and the Austin community at large. Although we strive to create a medium for African students to socialize and interact, ASO is open to students of all backgrounds. We aim to encourage and enhance awareness about African issues, culture and values. We are committed to advocate the rights of African students on the UT campus. We are eager to form ties with similar organizations here on UT.

title: Afrikan-American Affairs
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of Afrikan American Affairs is to provide support, enrichment services, and leadership development to Black students on campus, those in the greater Black community as well as anyone interested in Black culture.
fullDescription: The purpose of Afrikan American Affairs is to provide support, enrichment services, and leadership development to Black students on campus, those in the greater Black community as well as anyone interested in Black culture. This is achieved through dynamic programming and dialogue as well as through providing an online magazine, for students at the University of Texas at Austin, about information useful to the Black community.
twitterDescription: The mission of Afrikan American Affairs is to enrich the experience of African Americans on campus and unite the community through leadership development

title: Afterglow ATX
descriptionSnippet: We are an online music publication with a mission to publish innovative work.
fullDescription: We are an online music publication run by and for students. Our mission is to publish innovative work, ranging from local music news to album reviews to artist interviews/profiles to playlists, with a special focus on topical stories that push¬†boundaries on how we view different artists, genres, and trends.

title: All-Write All-Write All-Write
descriptionSnippet: All-Write All-Write All-Write introduces young fiction writers to literary opportunities and provide them with a space for writing and constructive criticism. All serious fiction writers are welcome!
fullDescription: All-Write All-Write All-Write introduces young fiction writers to opportunities in their field and provides them with a space for writing and constructive criticism. This semester, we will be meeting on Mondays from 5:30 to 6:30 in RLM 7.124 starting on February 11th. We hope to see you all there!

title: Almetris Duren Residence Hall Council
descriptionSnippet: Our purpose as a council is to represent the residents of Almetris Duren Hall in all their needs by sponsoring a diverse array of social, academic, self-interest/awareness and cultural activities.
fullDescription: Our purpose as a council is to represent the residents of Almetris Duren Hall in all their needs by sponsoring a diverse array of social, academic, self-interest/awareness and cultural activities. We will work efficiently to distribute funds equally to all types of hall programming. The council will continuously work to build a strong community within the residence hall, with University Housing and Dining (UHD), with the University Residence Hall Association (URHA) and, ultimately, The University of Texas at Austin.

title: Alpha Epsilon Delta - Pre-Health Honor Society
descriptionSnippet: Alpha Epsilon Delta is the nation's oldest and largest pre-health honor society. The Texas Alpha chapter of the University of Texas at Austin serves to prepare undergraduate students for future professional school aspirations.
fullDescription: Alpha Epsilon Delta is the nation's oldest and largest pre-health honor society. The Texas Alpha chapter of the University of Texas at Austin serves to prepare undergraduate students for their pursuit of a career in the health professions. AED offers opportunities for intellectual and professional development, provides a forum for students with common interests, and extends a program of service to benefit both the community and the individual.

title: Alpha Phi
descriptionSnippet: Founded in 1920, the Omega Chapter at The University of Texas at Austin was the first Alpha Phi chapter in Texas. Our members share a commitment to excellence and a strong desire to help one another and our communities.
fullDescription: The objectives of our Fraternity are the promotion of growth in character, unity of feeling, sisterly affection, and social communion among our members. In all that we do, we try to obey God's principles of justice and right. We have banded ourselves together to improve our minds and hearts, and we seek to aid each other through a constant watchcare always given in love. We believe ourselves to be sincere searchers for truth.

title: Alpha Phi Omega
descriptionSnippet: Texas APO is the premier co-ed service organization on the UT campus. We pride ourselves on the principles of leadership, friendship, and service, and have lots of exciting and meaningful opportunities to help the community and make close friends!
fullDescription: The Alpha Rho chapter of Alpha Phi Omega is the premier co-ed service organization on the UT campus. Our fraternity is based on the principles of leadership, friendship, and service. We give our members opportunities to volunteer on campus and in the community, create meaningful friendships, and develop personally and professionally through many leadership opportunities!¬†We can also be seen at home football games and many campus ceremonies with our World's Largest Texas Flag opened proudly.

title: Alternative Breaks - Student Chapter
descriptionSnippet: The Alternative Breaks program sends small groups of college students to communities outside central Texas to engage in meaningful service during their academic year breaks.
fullDescription: Alternative Breaks (AB) is a program within the¬†Longhorn Center for Community Engagement¬†that sends small groups of UT students to outside communities around the United States to help individuals grow as leaders and learn about social justice issues through an immersive service experience. Alternative Breaks is great for students who are passionate about social justice looking to spend their holiday break on a productive and interactive service learning experience. For more information visit utbreaks.org
twitterDescription: Equipping students to learn and serve alongside a new community.

title: American Marketing Association, UT Collegiate Chapter
descriptionSnippet: Texas AMA gives students the opportunity to learn about marketing and how to market themselves. AMA hosts guest speakers, workshops/certifications, marketing-based community service, and socials. AMA is open to all majors, so come out and join us!
fullDescription: Texas AMA¬†is an organization that gives students the opportunity to learn about the different aspects of marketing and how to market themselves. AMA hosts our Speaker Series where marketing professionals from different industries¬†come and talk about marketing in their field, workshops, AMA certifications in Market Research, Sales, and Career Development; and our community service is based around helping local non-profits overcome their marketing challenges.¬†This organization is open to all majors. All you need is an interest in or passion for marketing to join.
twitterDescription: We are marketing enthusiasts from @UTAustin. But most importantly, we are a group of cool people who are eager to learn and know how to have fun.

title: American Red Cross Club at The University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: The American Red Cross Club at The University of Texas at Austin's mission is to provide American Red Cross services to the University of Texas at Austin's community and surrounding areas. Members deliver these services acting in accordance with the Am...
fullDescription: The American Red Cross Club at The University of Texas at Austin's mission is to provide American Red Cross services to the University of Texas at Austin's community and surrounding areas. Members deliver these services acting in accordance with the American Red Cross Code of Conduct, under the guidelines of the Fundamental Principles of the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement, and in collaboration with the American Red Cross of Central Texas.
twitterDescription: As a branch of the American Red Cross of Central Texas, we provide Red Cross services to members of the UT community. Visit our website for more information.

title: American Society of Civil Engineers
descriptionSnippet: Since 1921, the American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE) at the University of Texas has been a perfect compliment to and integral part of the educational experience and career preparation for civil engineering students here at the University.
fullDescription: Since 1921, the American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE) at the University of Texas has been a perfect compliment to and integral part of the educational experience and career preparation for civil engineering students here at the University. ASCE student members have a greater understanding of their career interests and opportunities by the council and advice they receive at our chapter meetings from industry professionals.

title: Amnesty International - UT Chapter
descriptionSnippet: Amnesty International is the world's largest human rights organization. Here at UT, we are student activists who work to promote awareness about human rights abuses at home and around the world.
fullDescription: Amnesty International is the world's largest human rights organization. Here at UT, we are student activists who work to promote awareness about human rights abuses at home and around the world. We engage in multiple activities ranging from letter writing campaigns to attending local protests to volunteering in the Austin community.

title: Architectural Engineering Institute
descriptionSnippet: The Architectural Engineering Institute at UT is a nationally affiliated student organization devoted to providing architectural and civil engineering students with a link of communication to companies.
fullDescription: To enable architectural engineering students to exchange ideas about their future professions. Sociability is developed throughout the semester at meetings and activities allow members to meet and learn to interact effectively. Responsibility is developed through each project and commitment that is undertaken by the members involved. Professionalsim is developed as the student member becomes aware of his or her duties to all around him or her in their social and engineering encounters.

title: Asian Desi Pacific Islander American Collective
descriptionSnippet: The Asian Desi Pacific Islander American Collective (ADPAC) is an organization that serves, educates, and empowers the Asian Pacific Islander Desi American community at the University of Texas since 1995.
fullDescription: The Asian Desi Pacific Islander American Collective (ADPAC) is an organization that¬†serves, educates, and¬†empowers the Asian Pacific Islander Desi American community at the University of Texas since 1995. Additionally, our programming is open to all UT students who value diversity and cultural awareness.¬†Through leadership workshops, co-sponsorships, and student activism, we work to encourage Asian American students to connect and learn more about the resources, programs, and upcoming events available to them at UT.¬†We program several events throughout the year, such as You Bring Out the Asian American in Me (YBO), Asian American Leadership Institute (AALI), Breakthrough Conference, and Asian American Heritage Week.
twitterDescription: The official Twitter account of UT Austin's Asian Desi Pacific Islander American Collective (APAC)! :)

title: Association for Women in Science at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: AWIS at UT Austin connects its members with professionals in STEM in Austin. Our goal is to increase exposure to careers in STEM, discuss issues important to women in STEM, build a STEM network at UT, and promote the participation of young women in STEM.
fullDescription: The Association for Women in Science at UT Austin (AWIS at UT) strives to connect its members with women in STEM careers in Austin, be those in academia or industry. We work closely with the Austin Association for Women in Science, and our goals are to (1) increase exposure to the wide variety of career options in STEM, (2) bring to light issues important to women in STEM, (3) build a broad cross-disciplinary network of people in STEM at UT Austin, and (4) promote the participation of young women in STEM. We aim to accomplish these goals through career panels, speakers, discussion groups, networking events, mentoring activities, and outreach events. We are open to anyone who wishes to take advantage of the opportunities we provide (including undergraduates, graduate students, postdocs, faculty members, and those who identify as any gender).
twitterDescription: To learn more about AWIS at UT, please visit our website at https://t.co/cl1TZhx8dz

title: Beauties and the Beat
descriptionSnippet: The only all-female a cappella group at UT Austin that creates music that empowers women and brings it to campus, the Austin area, and around the country.
fullDescription: Beauties and the Beat is the only all female a cappella group at the University of Texas. We are a student led organization that was established in 2013, and since then we have performed all around Austin and have travelled to places ranging from Arkansas to Florida to compete in a cappella competitions, and we have opened for Anna Kendrick and performed at SXSW in the past. We are big believers in community involvement, and we perform at UT and around Austin as often as possible. As an all-female group, one of our main goals is to promote female empowerment through our music and our presence on campus.
twitterDescription: We are Beauties and The Beat, the only all-female a cappella group at The University of Texas at Austin!

title: Beta Beta Beta Biological Honor Society
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the BBB Biological Honor Society shall be to function as an honor and professional society for students of the biological sciences. We host service, academic and social events and are open to any Undergraduate student interested in Biology
fullDescription: Beta Beta Beta (Tri-Beta) Biological Honor Society (Kappa Upsilon Chapter) is an honor and professional society for students of and interested in the biological sciences. Activities are designed to stimulate interest, scholarly attainment, investigation in the biological sciences, and to promote the dissemination of information and new interpretations among students for the life sciences.

title: BeVocal: The Bystander Intervention Initiative of The University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: BeVocal is a university-wide bystander intervention initiative to promote the idea that individual Longhorns have the power to prevent high-risk behavior and harm.
fullDescription: BeVocal seeks to address multiple types of harm and enhance individual level self-efficacy to intervene as well as enhance collective responsibility and peer norms surrounding the importance of bystander intervention. ¬†We seek to shift the culture of campus with the promotion of intervention as a norm of our community, beginning at orientation through graduation. BeVocal - that's what Longhorns do.
twitterDescription: The Bystander Intervention Initiative of the University of Texas at Austin

title: Biomedical Engineering Society
descriptionSnippet: Promotion of the educational and professional interests of biomedical engineering students. Learn more at http://sites.utexas.edu/texas-bmes/.
fullDescription: BMES is both a professional and social organization for students interested in biomedical engineering. The organization strives to promote camaraderie and coherence between members of the biomedical engineering community, to increase awareness of the growing field of BME, and to open doors of opportunity to our members. title: Black Business Student Association
descriptionSnippet: The Black Business Association is dedicated to serving the professional academic, and social interests of our members. This organization helps business students achieve success within the McCombs School of Business and in their professional careers.
fullDescription: The Black Business Student Association (BBSA) of The University of Texas at Austin is a professional organization that was established to serve African Americans and business-minded students. Founded in October of 2005, BBSA is dedicated to providing academic, professional, and social support to students.
twitterDescription: BBSA is a professional organization that was established in October 2005 to serve African Americans and business-minded students.

title: Black Health Professions Organization- MAPS Chapter
descriptionSnippet: Uplifting future health professionals and engaging with the community. Meetings every other Wednesday!
fullDescription: The purpose of the Black Health Professions Organization is to foster an environment that supports minority undergraduates in their efforts to enter into a healthcare related¬†professional school. BHPO works to connect students with resources¬†including networking, shadowing, volunteering, and test prep. Though¬†we are not a social organization, members benefit from a close-knit¬†group that uplifts one another beyond professional development and¬†engages with the local community to improve health outcomes.
twitterDescription: The Black Health Professions Organization at THE University of Texas. Here to serve ALL pre-health students. Meetings every other Wednesday in BUR 116 @6PM.

title: Black Homecoming Planning Committee
descriptionSnippet: The Black Homecoming Planning Committee (BHPC) is a student organization committed to uniting current and former members of the African American community at the University of Texas at Austin.
fullDescription: The Black Homecoming Planning Committee (BHPC) is a student organization committed to uniting current and former members of the African American community at UT Austin. This will be accomplished through a mini week event that highlights the diversity within our culture that has only served to unify African and African American students on campus. BHPC is not only a pivotal organization for undergraduates at the university, but also the African American community at large. Though our initial focus is on the ethnic student population, we embrace and welcome all other cultures present on campus to take part in our celebration.

title: Black Honors Student Association
descriptionSnippet: The Black Honors Student Association is a student-led organization that strives to create a community between black honors students at the University of Texas.
fullDescription: The Black Honors Student Association (BHSA) is a student-led organization that fosters a community between UT‚Äôs black honors students, a historically underrepresented population in honors programs at the University of Texas. BHSA provides a safe space where students of all majors and programs are welcome to have the opportunity to network with other honors students and faculty, gain helpful insight and advice on courses, careers, and opportunities, and serve the community. Furthermore, BHSA serves as an outlet for discussing and addressing the issues and needs of black honors students at the university‚Äîcollectively giving this underrepresented community a voice. ¬†The organization seeks to increase the number of black students in honors programs through community outreach and student mentorship.

title: Campus Bike Alliance
descriptionSnippet: Improving the UT-Austin experience for all who bike on campus. Advocating for cycling infrastructure and resources for the health and safety of the student body and as a means of addressing affordability and sustainability.
fullDescription:
The Campus Bike Alliance is a student-led group open to all who are affiliated with the University of Texas at Austin. Our goals are to make the UT campus more bikeable, to promote cycling as a means of¬†addressing affordability and sustainability, and to represent the¬†large proportion of the student body that uses a bicycle for transportation.

Reaching our goals requires partnerships with academic and administrative units within UT, reciprocal relationships with professional and non-profit organizations outside of UT, and the dedication and hard work of students who are passionate about bikes.

To get involved, send us an email at campusbikealliance@gmail.com or attend a general meeting. It is a great opportunity to develop real-world skills and network with professionals while making a positive and lasting difference at the University of Texas.

If you are a professional or academic who would like to speak at one of our meetings or participate in an upcoming panel, please email us!
twitterDescription: CBA promotes active transportation among students, staff, and faculty by fostering bike culture on campus through a variety of initiatives and partnerships

title: Campus Environmental Center
descriptionSnippet: A community for those interested in the environment and sustainability. We explore, learn about, and act on a range of environmental issues. We empower UT to pursue a genuine culture of environmental sustainability through¬†constructive and dynamic means.
fullDescription: *Don't worry about joining us on HornsLink! We use this site as a database for our leaders and team members. To stay involved with us, follow our newsletter and social media accounts (listed below).
twitterDescription: We're a community of students who explore, learn about, and act on contemporary environmental issues at The University of Texas at Austin.

title: Campus Events + Entertainment
descriptionSnippet: To plan programs which educate, develop, entertain, and enlighten the students, faculty, and staff of The University of Texas at Austin and the surrounding community. To create a sense of community through programming and leadership experiences for the...
fullDescription: To plan programs which educate, develop, entertain, and enlighten the students, faculty, and staff of The University of Texas at Austin and the surrounding community. To create a sense of community through programming and leadership experiences for the students at UT Austin. To act as a resource for other student organizations. To provide a student voice in the allocation of student fee money for programming and leadership development.
twitterDescription: Campus Events + Entertainment is the largest student event-planning organization at The University of Texas at Austin. For students, by students.

title: Campus Events + Entertainment African American Culture

title: Campus Events + Entertainment Creative Arts and Theatre
descriptionSnippet: Campus Events and Entertainment's Creative Arts + Theatre is an arts organization that is open to all majors and experience levels. CA+T puts on events that are produced, written, directed, and performed by students for students.
fullDescription: Creative Arts + Theatre showcases student talent through events such as The Rocky Horror Picture Show Quote-Along; student-written plays, musicals, and musical revues; open mic nights;¬†visual arts exhibits;¬†and the Annual Madrigal Dinner. Students of all years and majors are welcome to join!

title: Campus Events + Entertainment Distinguished Speakers
descriptionSnippet: Distinguished Speakers is the premier student-run speaker series at The University of Texas at Austin. Members have the opportunity to plan and manage forums, panels and speaking events around topics and speakers who are interesting and influential!
fullDescription: Distinguished Speakers is the premier student-run speaker series at The University of Texas at Austin. Members have the opportunity to plan and manage forums, panels and speaking events around topics and speakers who are interesting, relevant and influential. ¬†We help broaden students‚Äô horizons and educate them on issues that impact their lives.

title: Campus Events + Entertainment Headliners
descriptionSnippet: Headliners, a committee of Campus Events + Entertainment, strives to bring large-scale, high profile concert, comedy, and entertainment events to UT students at no cost. Through its programs, Headliners hopes to bring valuable experiences to its members.
fullDescription:
Headliners is the major events wing of Campus Events + Entertainment. Headliners strives to bring large-scale, high profile concert, comedy, and entertainment events to UT students at no cost. Through its programs, Headliners hopes to bring students together in large numbers to foster a sense of shared community and school pride.

A member's experience in Headliners values a passion for music, friendship, event programing and leadership experience. Join our meetings at Monday 6pm in the Union Eastwoods Room to learn more about what we do!

title: Campus Events + Entertainment Mexican American Culture
descriptionSnippet: MACC promotes a diverse environment that celebrates the traditions and cultures of Latin America while offering leadership and growth opportunities through event planning, volunteerism and collaboration. We are a ‚Äúfamilia‚Äù united though pride.
fullDescription: Campus Events + Entertainment Mexican American Culture¬†Commitee (MACC)¬†promotes a diverse environment that celebrates the traditions and cultures of Latin America while offering leadership and growth opportunities through event planning, volunteerism and collaboration. We are a ‚Äúfamilia‚Äù united though pride in our heritage, respect for our history and vision for the future.

title: Campus Events + Entertainment Showtime
descriptionSnippet: Showtime programs events that center on media, pop culture, and student interests. In addition, Showtime oversees the Blockbuster and Late Night Film series and the Texas Union Film Festival(TUFF). Showtime screens films weekly and brings sneak previews.
fullDescription: Showtime programs events that center on media, pop culture, and student trends/interests. In addition, Showtime oversees the Blockbuster and Late Night Film series in the Texas Union Theatre and the Texas Union Film Festival (TUFF). Showtime seeks to bring students together through common interests in film, television, gaming, and current events. Past programming has included annual Outdoor movie screenings, Oscar Award winning films, showings of The Rocky Horror Picture Show, guest appearances by the Alamo Drafthouse's Master Pancake Theatre, and TV Marathons.
twitterDescription: Campus Events + Entertainment is the largest student event-planning organization at The University of Texas at Austin. For students, by students.

title: Campus Events + Entertainment Texas Traditions
descriptionSnippet: Texas Tradition hosts some of E+E's longstanding traditional programs: Texas Revue, Forty Acres Fest, & Longhorn Kickoff. Members have opportunities to learn how each unique event is put together and run, while building major event management skills.

title: Center for Asian American Studies
descriptionSnippet: The Center for Asian American Studies (CAAS) at The University of Texas at Austin is an interdisciplinary academic program promoting understanding and awareness of Asian Pacific American (APA) issues and communities.
fullDescription: Founded in 2000, the Center for Asian American Studies (CAAS) at The University of Texas at Austin is an interdisciplinary academic program promoting understanding and awareness of Asian Pacific American (APA) issues and communities. We house undergraduate major, minor, and honors programs and organize lectures, films, conferences, speakers' series, discussion forums, and collaborate partnerships with community and campus organizations. CAAS seeks to develop and highlight transnational and hemispheric perspectives and narratives of Asians in the Americas and the American South.
twitterDescription: The Center for Asian American Studies is an academic program promoting understanding and awareness of Asian Pacific American issues and communities.

title: Central Texas Model United Nations
descriptionSnippet: Central Texas Model UN participates in and hosts Model United Nations Conferences. CTMUN hosts two conferences for high school students, sponsors a traveling MUN team, and fosters a sense of community for UT students engaged in international affairs.
fullDescription: Central Texas Model United Nations (CTMUN) is a certified 501(c)3 non-profit organization that hosts multiple events throughout the school year. We host the CTMUN conference for over 500 high school students from all over Texas; student delegates engage in UN and non-UN (crisis) committees. We also sponsor a traveling MUN team, where Texas students go to collegiate level conferences across the country and the globe. CTMUN members interact with the local UNA-USA chapter and other international affairs groups on campus.
twitterDescription: Central Texas Model UN: A Non-Profit Model UN Organization.         Inspiring Youth | Creating Awareness | Investing in our Future

title: Chi Kappa Phi Service Society
descriptionSnippet: The mission of Chi Kappa Phi is to inspire a lifelong dedication to philanthropic service by fostering friendships strengthened through a tradition of scholarship and leadership.
fullDescription: Chi Kappa Phi is a service society established to benefit our campus and surrounding city. We hope to inspire a lifelong dedication to philanthropic service by fostering friendships strengthened through a tradition of scholarship and leadership. By doing so, we seek to contribute to our community by facilitating each member‚Äôs journey to discover and develop unique philanthropic interests. We will do this by providing numerous service opportunities; one of our main philanthropies will be a partnership with Oak Springs Elementary School.

title: Circle K International
descriptionSnippet: Circle K International (CKI) is an international collegiate service organization that is a sponsored leadership program of Kiwanis International. It promotes service, leadership, and fellowship.
fullDescription: Today, as the largest student-led collegiate service organization, CKI boasts a membership of more than 13,000 collegians on more than 500 campuses worldwide. CKI is led by an International Board of Representatives elected by its membership each year. Embodied by its tenets of leadership, fellowship, and service at the club, district, and International levels, CKI continues to grow through service to the world's campuses and communities.
twitterDescription: Circle K International at The University of Texas at Austin. Improving our community through service, leadership and fellowship! Meets Tuesdays @ 7p UTC 1.144

title: College Republicans at Texas

fullDescription: To proactively advance principles and values of the Republican Party on campus, to coordinate and provide logistical support to the Republican Party of Texas, to engage and educate the larger student population on contemporary political issues to induce interest in all levels of governmental affairs, and to cultivate a like-minded, center-right political family made up of primarily independents, conservatives, and libertarians.

title: Communication Council
descriptionSnippet: Our council's main purpose is to address student concerns in the College of Communication by fostering and maintaining a strong relationship with our college's administration. Additionally, we facilitate interactions between students, faculty , and sta...
fullDescription: Council's main purpose is to address student concerns in the Moody College of Communication by fostering and maintaining a strong relationship with our college's administration. Additionally, we facilitate interactions between students, faculty, and staff in the college; represent the college at University-wide events, and serve the city of Austin through our volunteer and community service outreach.

title: Council of Graduate Chemists
descriptionSnippet: The Council of Graduate Chemists serves on behalf of graduate students in the Department of Chemistry by means of fostering professional and community relationships, informing about school-wide policies, and advocating for our peers needs.
fullDescription: The Council of Graduate Chemists will serve to take ownership of what shapes our experience as graduate students in the Department of Chemistry at the University of Texas-Austin.¬† This group seeks to benefit all graduate students in chemistry by fostering professional and community relationships, informing about school-wide policies, and advocating for the needs of our peers.

title: Creative 40 Acres
descriptionSnippet: Creative 40 Acres celebrates extracurricular creative art-making and cultural expression by UT students wherever it flourishes on our campus.
fullDescription: Sponsored by the College of Fine Arts and the Dean of Students, the Creative 40 Acres¬†encourages originality and creativity, fosters student initiative and leadership, celebrates the cultural diversity of the campus community and cultivates the cultural and commercial value of students‚Äô original artistic work.

title: CultureX Texas
descriptionSnippet: CultureX Texas is a family of students gathered to help each other succeed during there time at UT. Members will have opportunities to volunteer with underprivileged communities in Austin, become apart of a family and immerse themselves in black culture.
fullDescription: CultureX Texas is a family of Black students gathered together to help each other succeed during there time at UT. Many African American students upon entering UT have a culture shook at the diversity that is UT. Through this organization we want to help students fell as comfortable¬† as possible here at UT by providing a safe space for students to thrive here on UT‚Äôs campus. Members will have opportunities to volunteer with underprivileged communities in Austin, become apart of a family that will be a home away from home, and educate themselves and other about black culture.

title: Delta Kappa Epsilon Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: Originally founded at Yale in 1844 and in 1912 at The University of Texas. Gentlemen, Scholars, and Jolly-Goodfellows. http://omegachidke.dekeunited.org/
fullDescription: Delta Kappa Epsilon is the only¬†fraternity who can boast having five presidents of the United States as alumni (Rutherford B.¬†Hayes, Theodore¬†Roosevelt, Gerald Ford, George H. W. Bush, and George W.Bush).¬†The Omega Chi chapter alone has brother Alan Bean, who brought our flag to the moon with him on the Apollo 12 mission, and brother Tom Landry who brought twenty consecutive wins¬†to the Dallas Cowboys. This fraternity turns men into leaders. Come out and join in our rush events!

title: Delta Sigma Pi
descriptionSnippet: Delta Sigma Pi is a professional fraternity organized to foster the study of business in universities; to encourage scholarship, social activity and the association of students for their mutual advancement by research and practice; to promote closer af..
fullDescription: Delta Sigma Pi is a professional fraternity organized to foster the study of business in universities; to encourage scholarship, social activity and the association of students for their mutual advancement by research and practice; to promote closer affiliation between the commercial world and students of commerce, and to further a higher standard of commercial ethics and culture and the civic and commercial welfare of the community.

title: Disability Advocacy Student Coalition
descriptionSnippet: The Disability Advocacy Student Coalition (DASC) is a student organization with the purpose of promoting awareness, advocacy and education about disabilities!
fullDescription: The Disability Advocacy Student Coalition (DASC) is a student organization with the purpose of promoting awareness, advocacy and education about disabilities on campus and in the surrounding community. Our pillars include advocacy and awareness, professionalism, friendship, and philanthropy. We are a disability hub for UT Austin. Meetings are held every Monday from 6-7 in SAC 1.118. Join us!
twitterDescription: DASC is a UT student organization partnered with SSD, committed to raising awareness about disability issues and advocating for accessibility on campus!

title: Diversity in Advertising & PR
descriptionSnippet: Our goal is to increase knowledge of advertising & public relations opportunities available for minority students, create a community to foster networking relationships, as well as promote diversity in the advertising and public relations field.
fullDescription: Diversity in Advertising and Public Relations was founded as Minorities in Advertising in 2013 at The University of Texas at Austin. A small group of female, multicultural woman looked around and realized that the industry lacked diversity and decided to try and change that. MIA would then go on to become Diversity in Advertising and PR (DA&PR), in order to become a more inclusive organization and to create an empowering space for like-minded individuals. We stand on the three pillars of diversity, networking, and professionalism.
twitterDescription: Showing new perspectives in advertising and PR at @UTAustin. Diversity | Networking | Professionalism. Email us at daprtx@gmail.com

title: Division of Diversity and Community Engagement
descriptionSnippet: Our division embraces and encourages diversity in all its forms. We strive for an inclusive community that fosters an open, enlightened, robust learning environment. A free exchange of ideas requires mutual respect and consideration for our differences.
fullDescription: Our division embraces and encourages diversity in all its forms. We strive for an inclusive community that fosters an open, enlightened and robust learning environment. A free exchange of ideas requires mutual respect and consideration for our differences. It is important to think of diversity not as a path toward uniformity, but as a way to acknowledge and value everyone‚Äôs varied experiences. This is especially vital in the increasingly multicultural state of Texas and global marketplace. All students, regardless of their backgrounds, benefit from a diverse learning environment.
twitterDescription: Division of Diversity and Community Engagement at @UTAustin fosters a diverse campus environment and engages with local communities traditionally underserved.

title: Division of Student Affairs
descriptionSnippet: As educators, Division of Student Affairs at The University of Texas at Austin supports students throughout their university experience by providing the best and most innovative programs, facilities and services.
fullDescription: With nine departments, 37 units and 38 facilities, the Division of Student Affairs provides a cutting-edge student experience by working with academic partners, staff, parents and student leaders. From orientation through graduation, the Division offers students access to first-class programs, facilities and services. They include 14 on-campus residence halls, dining facilities, medical and mental health services, new student orientation, recreational sports and two university unions. The Division employs 2,000 students annually and supports more than 1,100 student organizations, student emergency and veteran services, and leadership programs.
twitterDescription: @UTAustin‚Äôs Division of Student Affairs works w/ academic partners, staff, families & student leaders to influence students in living the Longhorn life.

title: ELPSA Student Organization
descriptionSnippet: The Higher Education Leadership and Policy Student Association (HELPSA) exists to support the pursuits of graduate students at UT Austin.
fullDescription: The Higher Education Leadership and Policy Student Association (HELPSA) exists to support the pursuits of graduate students at UT Austin, both at the Masters and Doctoral level, who are interested in the advancement of higher education administration through professional development, leadership, community building and networking, service, and mentorship.

title: Engineering Chamber Orchestra
descriptionSnippet: To create a college-wide musical society that provides flexible opportunities for students to enjoy making music together. The Orchestra ultimately envisions to establish a unique musical culture within the Cockrell School of Engineering and beyond.
fullDescription:
The Engineering Chamber Orchestra (EChO) is an organization open to all musically inclined students, faculty, and staff throughout The University of Texas at Austin. Its mission is to preserve musical interest and appreciation by encouraging its members to promote music in the community. Our organization offers members the opportunity to participate in unique chamber ensemble experiences not found anywhere else on campus.

EChO members rehearse a variety of music in ensembles of two to five members. At the end of each semester, they have the opportunity to showcase their efforts in a public concert series. Members also have opportunities to promote music music by teaching kids about the science behind music and performing at nursing homes.

Founded in the fall of 2009, EChO was immensely popular from its inception, with 70 new members grouped into small ensembles. In the spring of 2013, EChO started its first ever orchestra with only 13 string players. Now in its sixth year of existence, EChO boasts 157 members in 45 ensembles and one full orchestra with 38 performers.

title: Engineers for a Sustainable World
descriptionSnippet: ESW mobilizes students through education, technical projects, and collaborative action to impact local and global sustainability challenges. Instagram @ESWUT --- Twitter @ESW_UTEXAS --- Facebook @ESWUTEXAS
fullDescription:
Our chapter pursues many activities focused on the promotion of sustainability. Our members run¬†multiple technical projects at any given time, like our aquaponics team¬†or our solar power smoothie cart. We regularly attend various events around campus where we educate others on the benefits of sustainability, and we volunteer for activities like the Girl Day and Explore UT. We provide our members with a frame work to pursue their sustainable goals!

VISION
A world in which engineering fosters environmental, social, and economic sustainability

ESW mobilizes engineers and non-engineers through education, training, and action.¬†

title: Environmental Law Society
descriptionSnippet: To promote awareness of issues in environmental law.
fullDescription: The Environmental Law Society is a social and professional student organization at The University of Texas School of Law that coordinates and brings together environmentally-minded students for educational, volunteer, career-oriented and social events. ELS provides UT students with networking events, an environmental job database, and its members' various experiences in order to assist fellow members in pursuing environmental career opportunities both during and after law school. ELS also sponsors hiking and camping trips, happy hours, and speakers in an effort to provide a better Law School experience for its members.
twitterDescription: Environmental Law Society (ELS) at the University of Texas School of Law. ELS organizes events relating to environmental and natural resources law.

title: Epic Movement
descriptionSnippet: We are a missional movement that desires to know Jesus & to make His name known. We are committed to provide an environment and community that allows for the exploration, experience, & commitment to Christianity, especially in the Asian American context.
fullDescription: We are a missional movement that desires to know Jesus and to make His name known. We are committed to provide an environment and community that allows for the exploration, application, communication of the Christian faith, especially in the context of the Asian American culture.
twitterDescription: The Epic Movement at the University of Texas, a contextualized campus ministry of Cru.

title: Eta Kappa Nu: Electrical Engineering
descriptionSnippet: To honor outstanding electrical engineering students who have excelled in scholarship, character and leadership.
fullDescription: Eta Kappa Nu (HKN), Psi Chapter, is the Electrical and Computer Engineering Honor Society at the University of Texas at Austin. We provide a venue for upper-division ECE honor students to meet each other, interact with the corporate world, and serve the Department, the University, and the community. Like all chapters of HKN, we are dedicated to encouraging and recognizing excellence in the fields of Electrical and Computer Engineering.

title: Every Nation Campus
descriptionSnippet: Every Nation Campus (ENC) is a community of college students, centered on the Gospel, and set on impacting the culture. We desire to know and follow Jesus, making disciples that walk in the fear of the Lord and the power of the Spirit.
fullDescription: To teach from the Bible the message of Jesus Christ, and to provide an ethnically and racially diverse environment where students can grow and discover Christ with other students. Through leadership training and development, we hope to instill into students the desire for spiritual growth, self-improvement, scholastic and moral excellence, and civic responsibility.
twitterDescription: We bleed orange and die daily. Instagram: @everynationtexas

title: Fearless Leadership Institute Student Chapter
descriptionSnippet: Fearless Leadership Institute is an initiative for academic and personal development for students. Recognizing the importance of both personal and professional growth for undergraduates, FLI has two programmatic areas: personal & professional development
fullDescription: The Fearless Leadership Institute (FLI)¬†is designed to advance Black Women through academic excellence, professional development, and personal growth. Several campus programs are organized throughout the semester that focus on all aspects of personal and professional development. We hold weekly workshops to address topics ranging from financial responsibility to networking to healthy relationships. Our mission is to cultivate empowered and innovative women as they prepare to graduate from The University of Texas at Austin and move into the next stages of their lives.
twitterDescription: The Fearless Leadership Institute is a holistic development program for African American & Hispanic women at the University of Texas at Austin.

title: Feminist Action Project
descriptionSnippet: The Feminist Action Project is a student group at the University of Texas at Austin that organizes activist programs, conversations and events for gender justice with the collaboration of the Gender and Sexuality Center.
fullDescription: Our values as feminists include the intentional intersectional gender justice framework that strives to combat oppression and promote equity with awareness. We aim to exemplify these values by focusing on moving beyond binaries, valuing individual experiences, deconstructing privileges, and learning from history. We hope to accomplish these goals through openness and discussion, collective learning and engagement with other social justice communities, self-education and collaboration.
twitterDescription: Student org dedicated to feminism + gender justice ‚ú® READ ME: https://t.co/0P73rWKGnc

title: Fine Arts Council
descriptionSnippet: The Fine Arts Council serves as the official voice of the College of Fine Arts alongside the Senate of College Councils and Student Government to address academic affairs, student life, and university wide concerns.
fullDescription: The Fine Arts Council continually seeks to raise the standard of education for College of Fine Arts students at the University of Texas at Austin by facilitating student-faculty interaction, promoting academic excellence, encouraging collaboration between departments, and representing students in matters of college and university-wide concerns.
twitterDescription: Fine Arts Council serves as the official voice of the students of the College of Fine Arts, to the faculty and administration of the University.

title: Flow Conference Committee

title: Food Recovery Network-Longhorn Chapter
descriptionSnippet: We recover surplus food from restaurants and donate it to food banks, the Salvation Army, Caritas of Austin, and Street Youth Ministry. We pickup food from O's Cafe on campus. We also pickup bread from Mandalas, Upper Crust, and other local restaurants.
fullDescription: Recover Surplus food from UT Austin dining halls and local food stands and donate it to local Austin food banks.
twitterDescription: We are the Food Recovery Network at the University of Texas at Austin. Fighting waste and feeding people since 2012. Share your leftovers with us!

title: Gamma Rho Lambda
descriptionSnippet: We are UT's only LGBTQ+/progressive all-inclusive Greek organization! If you are in need of an accepting and fun family on the 40 acres, check us out, we would love to have you!
fullDescription: Gamma Rho Lambda is a Greek organization, a social safe space, and a family. We welcome everyone regardless of identity and would love to have you join us! We hold a series of rush events at the beginning of each semester, reach out to us and find us on Facebook for more info!

title: Gen U
descriptionSnippet: Organization for UT undergraduate students who identify as first generation
fullDescription: Gen U is intended to create a space for first-generation students, meaning that they are the first in their family to attend a post-secondary institution in the United States with the goal of graduating (it is acceptable by our standards that a student may identify as first generation even if one parent or guardian attended a post-secondary institution in a country outside of the United States as the education systems differ between countries and/or possible language barriers), to navigate school with the support of other first generation students. The mission of Gen U is ¬†to maximize their potential abilities and make use of any and all applicable resources to lessen obstacles that may present themselves for students in their pursuit of achieving academic goals. Our aim is to expand the knowledge of first generation students in social, academic, and professional settings.
twitterDescription: We are a First Generation Student Organization at UT Austin to help maximize the academic and professional potential of students

title: Gender & Sexuality Center: Serving Women and LGBTQA Communities
descriptionSnippet: The Gender and Sexuality Center provides opportunities for all members of the UT Austin community to explore, organize, and promote learning around issues of gender and sexuality.
fullDescription: The center facilitates a greater responsiveness to the needs of women and the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, questioning, and ally (LGBTQA) communities through education, outreach and advocacy. For an overview of what we do, see our Gender and Sexuality Center General Brochure (PDF). Hours: Monday ‚Äì Thursday, 9 am ‚Äì 7 pm and Friday, 9 am ‚Äì 5 pm. Summer Hours: Monday- Friday 9am-5pm E-Mail: gsc@austin.utexas.edu Phone: 512-232-1831 Visit: SAC 2.112

title: Gigglepants Improv Comedy Troupe
descriptionSnippet: Gigglepants is a short-form improv comedy troupe on the UT Campus Every show is made up on the spot and this never-been-done-before comedy is all based off of audience suggestions! We believe in good, clean, fun and we do it all for free!
fullDescription: Shortly after being founded in the harsh Austin winter of 2003, Gigglepants ascended to greatness to become UT's best (and only) short-form improv comedy troupe. We perform free shows to packed crowds on every other Friday night. Each show is completely made up on the spot, making each one a completely unique (and hilarious) experience.
twitterDescription: UT Austin's only short-form improv comedy troupe. Every show is free! (Did we mention our shows are FREE??)

title: Graduate Student Assembly
descriptionSnippet: The Graduate Student Assembly (GSA) is the principal legislative student organization representing graduate students to the University's administration. The GSA meets bi-weekly to discuss items of interest and concern to graduate students.
fullDescription: The¬†Graduate Student Assembly¬†provides a range of programming and events for the graduate student community including professional development, academic and departmental preparation workshops, social events. Our activities are meant to create a stronger graduate student community while also working to prepare them for their professional endeavors. Below you will find our platform for the upcoming year that focuses on five main areas: cost, climate, collaboration, communication, and civic engagement.
twitterDescription: We are @UTAustin's Graduate Student Assembly. Our mission is to advocate for grad & professional student needs. Tweet us w/ your thoughts on grad student life!

title: Grammy University Network - Texas Chapter
descriptionSnippet: GRAMMY U is a unique and fast-growing community of college students, primarily between the ages of 17 and 25, who are pursuing a career in the recording industry.
fullDescription: GRAMMY U is a unique and fast-growing community of college students, primarily between the ages of 17 and 25, who are pursuing a career in the recording industry. GRAMMY U events and special programs touch on all aspects of the music industry, from the technology to the tracks themselves. Events are scheduled throughout the semester to give GRAMMY U members a wide variety of experiences and professional development. Because we are part of The Recording Academy, members have extraordinary access to the industry and its artists.

title: Haven Student Fellowship

title: Health Careers Mentorship Program
descriptionSnippet: HCMP is a 100% student-led organization dedicated to teaching mature, motivated pre-medical students about both the clinical and non-clinical aspects of health care.
fullDescription: HCMP¬†is a 100% student-led organization dedicated to teaching mature, motivated pre-medical students about both the clinical and non-clinical aspects of health care. In addition to gaining valuable leadership experiences, selected individuals will develop relationships with health professionals within the Austin community. We provide an environment that fosters intellectual and personal growth, peer support and friendship, and ethical values.
twitterDescription: Health Careers Mentorship Program is a student-run organization at The University of Texas at Austin providing intensive doctor shadowing.

title: Health Occupations Students of America
descriptionSnippet: TX HOSA is a pre-health organization that offers shadowing, volunteer events, socials, guest speakers from a variety of healthcare professionals, and state and international competitions.
fullDescription: Our mission is to provide a forum for the discussion of health issues, aid students in preparing for professional health school, provide a social environment in which pre-health students can meet other pre-health students, and give our members the opportunity to give back to the community in the form of volunteer activities. TX HOSA offers shadowing, volunteer events, socials, guest speakers from a variety of healthcare professionals, and state and international competitions.

title: HERE
descriptionSnippet: Healing. Expressing. Resisting. Existing. We focus on amplifying the intersectional voices of the most censored and silenced identities on campus. We center the experiences of transgender and non-binary students while welcoming any marginalized identity.

title: Hispanic Association of Pharmacists
descriptionSnippet: Our organization strives to promote unity among pharmacy students with a common interest. Though we hold the Hispanic culture at our core, we invite all who are interested to join us as we serve our community and promote the practice of pharmacy.
fullDescription:
The purpose of the student chapters of HAP is to encourage and promote unity¬†among pharmacy students with common interests, values, and backgrounds. HAP¬†provides a student support network on a social level aimed at achieving academic¬†excellence while balancing a friendly, relaxed, and entertaining atmosphere¬†outside of the classroom. HAP will focus on service projects throughout the¬†year to educate, assist, and support Hispanic culture through health care and¬†community development.

The organization at large strives to promote education services for the Hispanic¬†community. It also provides a network of Hispanic pharmacy professional¬†mentors for students. The organization will develop research methods and¬†maintain documentation to better understand Hispanic use of medicines.
twitterDescription: UT Austin student pharmacist group, leading students and professionals, promoting Hispanic culture and health awareness, social events, and community service.

title: Hispanic Business Student Association
descriptionSnippet: HBSA is dedicated to promoting professionalism, integrity, academic excellence, and charity. Our mission is to provide a medium to enhance ourselves academically and culturally & serve as an information center for scholastic and occupational opportunity
fullDescription: Established in 1976, The Hispanic Business Student Association is committed to bringing out the best in its members and preparing them for success in the corporate world. Long regarded as one of the top organizations at The University of Texas at Austin, HBSA continues to provide its 180+ members with unparalleled professional and leadership opportunities. Through the numerous programs HBSA hosts throughout the year, including our signature events, Company Night and Scoring Careers, HBSA has helped increased the number of Hispanic professionals entering the work force. Our consistent hard work has led to many accolades. The most recent accolades include Swing Out's Best Recreational Organization award and The Most Outstanding Organization in McCombs School of Business. Our four pillars include Academics, Community Service, Professionalism, and Family.

title: Horns for Liberty
descriptionSnippet: Horns for Liberty is a libertarian/classical liberal organization which focuses on the philosophy of liberty and liberalism and its applications in various fields.
fullDescription: From science and law to economics and ethics, it is our belief that in all facets of our world, more freedom is always better. We believe in the right of every individual to live their life completely as they choose, free from all regulation, taxation, or law outside of natural law. We support free market capitalism, limited government, decentralization of money, legalization of recreational drugs,¬†gay marriage, freedom of speech, and abolition of the income tax, to give a few examples. Our goal is to spread the ideas of liberalism and liberty among the students and faculty of UT by educating each of our members in the foundations of the classical liberal philosophy. We discuss influential literature, film, philosophy, poetry, economics and politics in the development of liberalism, as well as relevant current events, all with the hope of elucidating to each member the value of personal freedom and the implications it has in other aspects of our world.

title: Horns for Life
descriptionSnippet: We are a consistent life organization working to spread a culture of life on campus through outreach, volunteering, and awareness.
fullDescription: Horns¬†for Life is the non-sectarian student group at the University of Texas dedicated to promoting a consistent life ethic on campus and around the community. We are devoted to affirming the fundamental dignity and equal value of all human lives, at all stages and in all circumstances. We lovingly serve our community by educating ourselves and our peers on many life-threatening issues. We oppose and work to bring an end to abortion, capital punishment, euthanasia, embryonic stem cell research, and unjust war. We provide opportunities for meaningful, respectful discussion of these topics. Through volunteering and our Pregnant on Campus initiative, we support the most vulnerable people in our community.
twitterDescription: Horns for Life seeks to educate our UT family on life issues & support those who are experiencing an unplanned pregnancy or hurting from abortion.

title: Humanity First - Texas Chapter
descriptionSnippet: Humanity First - TX Chapter is a student branch of Humanity First, an international relief organization focused on human development and disaster relief for all communities and peoples, whether through volunteering, community engagement, or fundraising.
fullDescription: As a student branch of Humanity First USA, our student organization will serve to provide non-discriminatory humanitarian relief and service to mankind, both in the local community as well as abroad. Our projects will focus on improving our community at the University and of Greater Austin, through volunteering, service projects, and fundraising activities. We will also assist our international programs such as Water for Life and Our Kids, Our Future through community education, awareness, and fundraising. In all, the purpose of the organization is to provide the maximum amount of service to all those in need.
twitterDescription: Chapter at @UTAustin. Drawing strength from our domestic and global resources to relieve worldwide suffering

title: Hyperloop Engineering at The University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: We are currently working to design and build a prototype of a pod to compete in SpaceX's Hyperloop Pod competition in August 2019.
fullDescription: Hyperloop Engineering at the University of Texas is the official name of the Texas Guadaloop and 512 Hyperloop teams from the University of Texas at Austin. In September of 2017, the two formerly rival teams from UT decided to merge together under the name Texas Guadaloop, retaining the best talent and resources from both teams.
twitterDescription: Texas‚Äôs premier Hyperloop Engineering Research group actively working towards high-speed air bearing technology

title: IEEE Robotics and Automation Society
descriptionSnippet: Check out our website at ras.ece.utexas.edu and text @ut-ras to 81010 to receive text message updates from RAS!
fullDescription: inspires robotics research and aspires to make robotics more accessible to persons of all backgrounds. Since 1997, from our primary residence in UT's Electrical and Computer Engineering department, we have connected undergraduate students from mechanical, electrical, aerospace, computer, and other engineering (and non-engineering) fields. We help students gain practical multi-disciplinary experience in the lab, then demonstrate our abilities at various robotics competitions while promoting robotics via community outreach.
twitterDescription: Robotics and Automation Society at the University of Texas. Our activities include collegiate robotics competition and mentoring high school robotics teams.

title: If/When/How Texas Law
descriptionSnippet: If/When/How is a national network of law students and lawyers who are committed to reproductive justice. We believe all people should have the ability to decide if, when, and how to create and sustain a family.
fullDescription: If/When/How is a national network of law students and lawyers who are committed to reproductive justice. We believe all people should have the ability to decide if, when, and how to create and sustain a family. Our chapter engages in activism, advocacy, and volunteer projects around reproductive health, rights, and justice.
twitterDescription:
We seek to educate and engage the @UTexasLaw community around reproductive health, rights, and justice. 
ifwhenhow.texaslaw@gmail.com.

title: Ignite Texas
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of Ignite Texas is to provide a weekend of spiritual growth to incoming freshmen through the unity of the body of Christ established on campus at UT. The retreat provides outreach and resources to establish their faith in college.
fullDescription: Ignite Texas is a four-day retreat for incoming freshmen and transfer students who are looking to find Christian community at the University of Texas. With a band and speaker, small group time, and fun camp traditions, the retreat not only provides students with friends and community before arriving to campus, but also gives them the tools they need to seek spiritual growth during their time at UT.

title: Indian Cultural Association
descriptionSnippet: With various events and meetings, our ultimate mission is to foster a strong appreciation for diversity and the preservation of the Indian culture on the campus and in the community as a whole.
fullDescription: UT Indian Cultural Association seeks to increase awareness about the South Asian heritage at The University of Texas at Austin. Founded on the three tenets of culture, community, and camaraderie, the Indian Cultural Association serves UT Austin as a cultural liaison to spread influence of the Indian ethnic identity. With various social, service, cultural, and professional¬†events, our ultimate mission is to foster a strong appreciation for diversity and the preservation of the Indian culture on the campus and in the community as a whole.

title: Indian Students Association
descriptionSnippet: Established in 1954, the Indian Students Association (ISA) is currently one of the largest student organizations on campus with over 150 paid members. We are an umbrella organization that aims to connect all South Asian organizations on campus and cont...
fullDescription: Established in 1954, the Indian Students Association (ISA) is currently one of the largest student organizations on campus with over 150 paid members. We are an umbrella organization that aims to connect all South Asian organizations on campus and continue to spread awareness of our philanthropic ventures. Over the past year we have donated more than $10,000 to charities all over the globe. In the Fall, we hold events such as Jeena which is a national south asian A Capella competition. In the Spring, we hold our annual talent competition, TAAL, which showcases UT Talent to a crowd of over 2,000 people.
twitterDescription: Indian Students Association at the University of Texas at Austin. Service. Culture. Social.

title: Innervisions Gospel Choir
descriptionSnippet: Innervisions Gospel Choir was founded with the purpose of spreading and ministering the Gospel according to Jesus Christ.
fullDescription: Innervisions Gospel Choir was founded with the purpose to spread and minister the Gospel according to Jesus Christ; to reach out to our fellow man, by introducing to some and presenting to others that there is a reality in serving a true and living God.

title: Institute of Transportation Engineers
descriptionSnippet: ITE seeks to inform students about current events in Transportation Engineering and connect with leaders in the field in both consulting and research through speaker events, conferences, and various social activities.
fullDescription: ITE's objective is: Promote the advancement of transportation and traffic engineering by fostering the close association of students with transportation and traffic engineering through the medium of addresses by competent speakers and of Chapter sponsored trips; foster the development of professional spirit; promote common interests among chapter members; encourage the expansion of facilities for transportation and traffic engineering study.

title: Interfraternity Council
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the Interfraternity Council (IFC) is to act as the governing body for all IFC fraternities. In conjunction with this purpose the IFC also operates as the liaison for the fraternities and provides services to its member fraternities.
fullDescription: The purpose of the IFC is to act as the governing body for all Greek Letter Social Fraternities. In conjunction with this purpose the IFC also operates as the liason for the fraternities and provides services to its member fraternities.
twitterDescription: The Texas Interfraternity Council (IFC) governs 30 social fraternities consisting of more than 2,500 men at @UTAustin.

title: International Affairs Society
descriptionSnippet: The International Affairs Society (IAS) is a professional and social organization catering to students in with an interest in international relations, global affairs, cultural interaction, and travel.
fullDescription: The International Affairs Society (IAS) is a professional and social organization at the University of Texas at Austin whose mission is to cater to students interested in international relations, global affairs, cultural interaction, and travel.¬†We foster both professional and social relationships between students, academic faculty, and professionals from various fields. Whatever each member‚Äôs unique reason is for joining the organization, the International Affairs Society provides opportunities to fit each member's interest. Whether it be through a current events discussion, career development workshop, diplomatic etiquette, distinguished speaker, or community service, IAS creates a society in which students can thrive and become global citizens. Every meeting includes a guest speaker with a different internationally themed topic, ranging from study programs and internships abroad, to presentations by international non-governmental organizations. IAS also hosts a number of signature events throughout the year, including the International Affairs Roundtable and the Global Feast.
twitterDescription: The International Affairs Society at UT Austin is dedicated to helping students learn about different people, cultures, and experiences from around the world.

title: International Business Student Association
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of International Business Student Association is to expand member‚Äôs knowledge of global issues that affect the way we do business. We are committed to international and cultural awareness, professional and social development, and leadership.
fullDescription: The purpose of International Business Student Association (IBSA) at The University of Texas at Austin is to expand member‚Äôs knowledge of global issues that affect the way we do business. We are an organization committed to learning about foreign business practices, culture, and customs in ways that will provide us with better global understanding of our international economy. For this reason, we advocate international and cultural awareness because we believe that as business professionals, global leaders, and members of society, it is important to understand international issues that affect business practices. We promote interaction with international and exchange students while also advocating professional and social development because we believe it is a gateway to building a network of exceptional connections.

title: International Office
descriptionSnippet: The International Office at The University of Texas at Austin is home to Study Abroad, International Student & Scholar Services, ESL Services and more.
fullDescription:
As one of the nation‚Äôs leading public universities, The University of Texas at Austin prepares its students to become competent global citizens. The International Office advances the critical priorities of the University by creating access to international and cultural exchange. As the institutional home for Study Abroad, International Student & Scholar Services, English as a Second Language instruction, Global Risk & Safety, and Global Initiatives, the International Office provides opportunities to learn about the world through education.

The University is host to almost 5,000 matriculated international students, 800 English as a Second Language students, and 1,500 international faculty and scholars from more than 120 countries. The diversity that these talented students and scholars bring to the campus, provide critical cross-cultural experiences that enrich lives, instill global competency, and strengthen the university community, state and nation.

title: Iranian Students Academic and Cultural Organization
descriptionSnippet: The Iranian Students Academic and Cultural Organization is non-profit, independent from any specific political and religious beliefs with emphasis on academic and cultural orientation of students of The University of Texas at Austin....
fullDescription: The Iranian Students Academic and Cultural Organization is non-profit, independent from any specific political and religious beliefs with emphasis on academic and cultural orientation of students of The University of Texas at Austin. title: It's On Us at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: It's On Us at UT Austin works to educate students and prevent sexual assault on the 40 acres by hosting events, speakers, and campaigns. We strive to assist UT students in understanding that stopping sexual assault is on us.
fullDescription: It's On Us was created by the Obama Administration to combat the rising statistics of sexual assault on college campuses. As an official student lead chapter, It's On Us at UT Austin hopes to reach out to all students on campus to hear their stories, to educate them, and to work with them. We will reach these goals by hosting events such as the Fall and Spring Weeks of Action, hosting advocates against sexual assault to speak on campus, and changing the culture that allows sexual assault to transpire.

title: Kappa Alpha Theta
descriptionSnippet: In 1904, Alpha Theta Chapter at the University of Texas became the second Theta chapter in the South. We stand for sisterhood, philanthropy, character, and academic excellence.
fullDescription:
Founded in 1870 at Indiana Asbury (now DePauw University) in Greencastle, Indiana, Kappa Alpha Theta is the first Greek-letter Fraternity known among women.¬†In 1904, Alpha Theta Chapter at the University of Texas became the second Theta chapter in the South. We stand for sisterhood, philanthropy, character and academic excellence.

Since 1989, Kappa Alpha Theta has supported the advocacy work of¬†CASA for Children, our international philanthropy. We share CASA‚Äôs belief that all children have the fundamental right to be safe, and to be treated with dignity and respect.¬†Court Appointed Special Advocates‚ÄîCASA volunteers‚Äîwork with children who have been removed from the home due to abuse or neglect. A CASA volunteer provides a voice for the child in the courtroom and the community.

title: Kappa Delta Chi Sorority, Incorporated
descriptionSnippet: The Purpose of Kappa Delta Chi is to promote the values of Unity, Honesty, Integrity and Leadership among women at colleges and universities....
fullDescription: Kappa Delta Chi Sorority, Inc. is a national sorority that fosters¬†professional development, academics and lifelong learning, and higher education degree¬†attainment; an organization dedicated to community service¬†for institutions of higher education¬†and¬†the community with an emphasis on the Hispanic/Latino population.

title: Kappa Kappa Gamma
descriptionSnippet: Kappa Kappa Gamma is an all women's sorority organization located at 2001 University Avenue and founded in 1902. Our goals are to promote leadership, scholarship and friendship to women who attend the University of Texas.

title: Kappa Phi Gamma Sorority, Inc.
descriptionSnippet: In 1998, Kappa Phi Gamma Sorority, Inc. became America's first women's Greek-letter organization to promote a South Asian interest.
fullDescription: We, the Sisters of Kappa Phi Gamma Sorority, Inc.,¬†shall create a Sisterhood directed towards the advancement of women. Kappa Phi Gamma aims to instill integrity of character and trust as components of personality. The Sorority shall encourage bonding of women in order to strengthen Sisterhood. We shall render service to the community and the university, thus supporting the betterment and unification of society. The Sisterhood shall develop leadership skills and high academic standards that follow into the professional world. Kappa Phi Gamma shall promote pride of culture, womanhood, and self.‚Äã

title: Kappa Phi Lambda Sorority, Inc.
descriptionSnippet: Kappa Phi Lambda Sorority, Inc. provides an opportunity for young women to be involved on campus through service and cultural events while joining a sisterhood that develops strong bonds and leadership skills.
fullDescription: ‚ÄúWe, the sisters of the Kappa Phi Lambda Sorority, Incorporated, strive to strengthen Sisterhood amongst women by providing Service and promoting Cultural Diversity to our members and our community, thus securing the bond of kinship for posterity. Kappa Phi Lambda exists to further educate individuals about Pan-Asian culture, while keeping our own identities. We aim for academic excellence, keeping in mind the importance of education and learning as the key to strength, awareness, and fulfillment.‚Äù

fullDescription:
Provide for networking among co-op students, promote career opportunities through industry, provide inside information to the general student body about the co-op program and create programs to keep students academically sharp while on leave.¬†Personal qualities of members of our society are distinguished scholarship, integrity, breadth of interest, and adaptability.
