title: Labyrinth Progressive Student Ministry
descriptionSnippet: Labyrinth is a progressive Christian community that is LGBTQ-friendly, racially inclusive, and open to all students, whether atheist, questioning, or devout. Labyrinth members are an open, diverse group and a true community.
fullDescription: "Labyrinth" functions as an ecumenical campus ministry for students of all races, genders, orientations, faiths, denominations and those who are looking to seek a greater understanding about ancient Christianity and how it applies to our modern age.¬†Whether you‚Äôre a long-time believer, or hopeful skeptic at best, spirituality in college is a journey with twists, turns, and dead ends. You have questions and beliefs, doubts and dreams, and school work to go along with it. Here at Labyrinth, we welcome and encourage you on your journey by providing a safe place to ask questions about God, explore and grow in your spirituality, and connect with other students. College can feel like a maze ‚Äî we can help you find your way.
twitterDescription: Labyrinth Progressive Student Ministry is a safe and inclusive place for students journeying on any path of faith, whether atheist, questioning, or devout.

title: Lambda Omega Alpha Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: Lambda Omega Alpha is a fellowship of Catholic men brought together by faith. We engage in social, service, and spiritual activities often during the school year. Please contact us at loa@utcatholic.org for more information.
fullDescription: Lambda Omega Alpha is a Catholic Men's Fraternity founded in 1990 by a group of five young men at a retreat called Longhorn Awakening. They were so moved at this retreat that they wanted to bring that experience back to UT. They created a brotherhood rooted in the pillars of loyalty, spirituality, and chivalry. Based out of the University Catholic Center at the University of Texas at Austin, the Alpha Chapter of Lambda Omega Alpha serves as a means by which college-aged men, united in fellowship by their faith, are able to grow together guided by these pillars.
twitterDescription: Catholic fraternity rooted in the pillars of loyalty, spirituality, and chivalry at The University of Texas at Austin. Instagram: @loaalphas

title: Latin Economics and Business Association
descriptionSnippet: We recruit passionate and driven students who wish to expand their knowledge, develop professional skills and establish life-long relationships among Latin American cultures through talks from leading experts in business, social gatherings & philanthropy
fullDescription: The Latin Economics and Business Association is a prominent student organization in the McCombs School of Business. Our mission is to recruit passionate students who are driven and committed to expand their knowledge, foster relationships across Latin American cultures, and develop their professional skills. We do this by offering a range of opportunities of growth through community service, social gatherings, athletic activities, expert led talks, and recruiting events. Our vision is to help shape well-rounded individuals and leaders of tomorrow.

title: Latinx Health Professions Organization
descriptionSnippet: 1) Provides Hispanic pre-med, allied health, and pre-dent students with academic information, peer support, and cultural camaraderie. 2) Disseminates information concerning various health professions and programs and their application procedures. 3) Sa...
fullDescription: 1) Provides Hispanic pre-med, allied health, and pre-dent students with academic information, peer support, and cultural camaraderie. 2) Disseminates information concerning various health professions and programs and their application procedures. 3) Salient aspect of NCHO is the academic and personal support that lower-division students receive from upper-division and medical students.

title: Latinx Honors Student Association at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: LHSA serves to provide a community for Latinx students in honors programs, including but not limited to: The Plan II Honors Program, Liberal Arts Honors, Business Honors Program, and all other departmental honors programs.
fullDescription: LHSA serves to provide a community for Latinx students in honors programs, including but not limited to: The Plan II Honors Program, Liberal Arts Honors, Business Honors Program, and all other departmental honors programs. We will also offer service opportunities for members to engage in, such as mentor ship programs, ambassador-like activities, and other programs. LHSA wants Latinx students to feel a sense of community and belonging in UT's large campus and honors programs.

title: Liberal Arts Council
descriptionSnippet: Liberal Arts Council serves as the official voice of the students in the College of Liberal Arts.
fullDescription: Council shall devote itself to the mission¬†of the Liberal Arts by: providing a means of communication between faculty and students; assisting in the improvement of academic standards; investigating student issues in the college; improving student awareness of the college across the campus.

title: Liberty in North Korea - Texas
descriptionSnippet: Liberty in North Korea at The University of Texas aims to spread awareness of the North Korean humanitarian crisis to all UT students and to raise funds to support and rescue North Korean refugees.
fullDescription: LiNK Texas was founded in August of 2004 and has since consistently been one of LiNK's leading rescue team. We are a nonprofit and nonpolitical organization that focuses on the humanitarian crisis that is currently going on within North Korea. LiNK Texas aims to raise funds, spread awareness, and change the narrative on this issue that is often ignored due to the current political climate. All funds raised go directly to helping a North Korean refugee be rescued, relocated, and reeducated.

title: Longhorn Chi Alpha Christian Fellowship
descriptionSnippet: We exist to Know God, Love People, and Change the World. If you have been a strong Christian for many years or are interested in knowing about Jesus for the first time this is a safe place for you to find a 2nd family that will love and encourage you n...
fullDescription: We exist to Know God, Love People, and Change the World. If you have been a strong Christian for many years or are interested in knowing about Jesus for the first time this is a safe place for you to find a 2nd family that will love and encourage you no matter what you ultimately believe about God. We desire to be authentic and genuine in the way we live and share the love of Jesus with those around us through finding needs to serve both our university and others around the world.

title: Longhorn Christian Fellowship
descriptionSnippet: Longhorn Christian Fellowship desires to glorify God by walking with individuals and helping them dive deeper into their understanding and love for Jesus Christ. We aim to help all people grow in their faith.
fullDescription: Longhorn Christian Fellowship desires to glorify God by walking with individuals and helping them dive deeper into their understanding and love for Jesus Christ. We aim to help all people grow in their faith through Christian community, biblical teaching, and loving accountability. Weekly LCF activities include one-on-one discipleship, small group Bible studies, and corporate worship.

title: Longhorn EMS
descriptionSnippet: Longhorn EMS is an agency of Student Government with a mission to provide excellence in emergency response and education. Every active member in this volunteer medical response organization is a certified EMT, committed to serving the UT community.
fullDescription: Longhorn EMS is an agency of student government composed of certified EMTs. Our past activities have included serving as medical standby at UT football games, 5K runs across Austin, and other special events. We have spent many years volunteering with the Special Olympics of Texas and the Boy Scouts of America to provide emergency care and education. You can find us at UT events, organization meetings, and pursuing community outreach to educate the Austin public in innovative and life-saving techniques.
twitterDescription: We are an agency of the University of Texas Student Government dedicated to serving the University of Texas community through excellence in emergency response.

title: Longhorn Entrepreneurship Agency
descriptionSnippet: LEA is the center of mass for student-run entrepreneurship at UT. We foster and promote student entrepreneurship through programs such as Freshman Founders, UT's first student coworking space, annual Entrepreneurship Weeks and Startup Job Fairs, and more.
fullDescription: The Longhorn Entrepreneurship Agency is an agency of Student Government that strives to connect, educate, and support student entrepreneurs while developing and fostering an innovative startup culture on campus. Formed in September 2012, we were charged with the mission of making student entrepreneurs as celebrated as student athletes. Soon after, we began to move past simply promoting student entrepreneurs to actively supporting and providing a home for student-run entrepreneurship.

title: Longhorn Fellowship of Christian Athletes
descriptionSnippet: The core value of FCA at the University of Texas is the advancement of¬†the gospel of Jesus Christ throughout the world¬†through coaches and athletes. We want nothing more than for all students athletes, coaches, and UT students to know Jesus Christ.
fullDescription: Our motto as an organization is to spread the gospel to and through student athletes. We live from the word, Matthew 24:14 says "This gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in the whole world as a testimony to all the nations, and then the end will come". For our Texas chapter, we do this through meeting every week¬†when school is session, inviting all athletes, coaches,¬†staff, and students. We often throughout the semester support sports teams by attending a sport's competition and cheering them on as a huddle. As a huddle, it's all about Jesus¬†and our huddle¬†past and present have kept it that way.
twitterDescription: Fellowship of Christian Athletes at The University of Texas at Austin||Huddle: Mondays at 8:00pm||Location: Moncrief meeting room||ALL Texas athletes welcome

title: Longhorn Gaming
descriptionSnippet: Longhorn Gaming is the central gaming community at UT. No matter your background, what game you play, or your skill level, LG is the club for you. We host LAN parties, compete in tournaments, and love to just hang out and play video games together.
fullDescription:
Welcome to Longhorn Gaming, where casual meets competitive.

We bring people together on campus to create a community at UT for gamers from all different backgrounds and skill levels. Whether you play casually or competitively, multiplayer or single player, Longhorn Gaming is the place for you!

We host LANs, watch parties, compete in collegiate esports leagues, and provide opportunities for UT gamers to hang out together.

title: Longhorn Hellraisers
descriptionSnippet: The Longhorn Hellraisers is Loudest and Proudest student org on campus, dedicated to supporting UT Athletics by creating an exciting and winning environment at sporting events.
fullDescription: To raise spirit at The University of Texas by attending sporting events with our faces painted orange and white and participating in cheers.

title: Longhorn League of United Latin American Citizens
descriptionSnippet: Being a member of LULAC is an exceptional beginning, providing opportunities for leadership, responsibility, perseverance, commitment, education, community involvement, and so much more. Welcome to the family and our team of dedicated advocates!
fullDescription: Our mission is to advance the economic condition, educational attainment, political influence, health, housing and civil rights of the Hispanic population in the United States.

title: Longhorn Legislative Aides
descriptionSnippet: Internship within Student Government that works with the Executive Board, Assembly, and other agencies in order to deal with issues on campus. Mentors, Friends, and memories come with being an LLA. LLA will mature each intern in the professional world.
fullDescription: Longhorn Legislative Aide is a first-year leadership agency within student government designed to develop the University of Texas's future leaders. LLAs are an active group of twenty interns that provide feedback and help author resolutions to issues across campus while working closely with the Student Government Executive Board, Assembly, and other agencies. LLAs will understand what it means to be a longhorn by focusing on the UT core values of Learning, Leadership, and Responsibility.
twitterDescription: Join a family like no other. Official‚ÄºÔ∏è account of Longhorn Legislative Aides - shaping UT's leaders and influencers of tomorrow! (an agency of @UT_SG)

descriptionSnippet: UT Austin Chapter of Formula SAE and Solar Vehicle Teams
fullDescription: Longhorn Racing provides students with the opportunity to explore different engineering fields and grow their tangible skills through a collaborative and innovative environment. ¬†Each year we design, build and test two formula style vehicles (electric and internal combustion) from scratch. ¬†Every 3-4 years, we design, build and test a solar-powered vehicle as well. ¬†All of our vehicles compete every summer in locations across the nation.

title: Longhorn Singers
descriptionSnippet: A co-educational show choir providing UT Austin with entertainment and UT Spirit.
fullDescription: Providing ‚ÄúEntertainment in the Finest College Tradition,‚Äù Longhorn Singers was founded in 1958 by Dr. Morris Beachy by joining together the men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs glee clubs of the school of music into one ensemble. He envisioned new group for the university, one that joined singers from all educational backgrounds to promote a sense of Texas pride‚Äîboth for our school and our state. Now, half a century later, the group has evolved into who we are today: the premier show choir of The University of Texas at Austin.

title: Longhorn Wrestling
descriptionSnippet: Men's and Women's collegiate Wrestling team at the University of Texas.
fullDescription: Longhorn Wrestling is a co-ed, student-run sports team on the Forty Acres that focuses on leadership, discipline, and perseverance. We train wrestlers of all skills levels by practicing for two hours Monday through Thursday each week. Our season starts in October and we compete in National Collegiate Wrestling Association (NCWA) tournaments across Texas until March. The NCWA National Championships are hosted in Allen, TX at the beginning of March each year. We have both competitive and non-competitive memberships, both of which enjoy access to all of our practices, workouts, training & dieting routines.

title: MEDLIFE at The University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: Longhorn MEDLIFE seeks to deliver aid to families and communities in need all over the globe through three broad avenues: Medicine, Education, and Development.
fullDescription: MEDLIFE is an international, non-profit organization with a mission to help families achieve greater freedom from the constraints of poverty, empowering them to live healthier lives. Our patients did not choose to be poor, but they have chosen to strive toward a better life; MEDLIFE stands beside them in this pursuit.
twitterDescription: Our goal is to build a worldwide movement empowering the impoverished in their fight for equal access to healthcare, education, and a safe home.

title: Minorities in Education
descriptionSnippet: Our purpose is to assist in the recruiting of students for education careers, to promote higher education among low income students in Austin, to provide a social outlet in the campus environment, and to help develop professional career awareness.
fullDescription: Our purpose is to assist in the recruitment and retention of students in education careers, to provide a social and volunteering outlet in the campus environment, and to provide professional development opportunities and connections for members.
twitterDescription: Minorities In Education is an organization at the University of Texas at Austin dedicated to minority students and bettering education - open to all majors

title: Mu Rho Chapter of Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity Incorporated
descriptionSnippet: Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity was founded at Howard University in Washington, D.C., January 9, 1914. The founders wanted to organize a Greek letter fraternity that would truly exemplify the ideals of brotherhood, scholarship and service.

title: Multicultural Greek Council
descriptionSnippet: The MCG mission is to unite multicultural sororities and fraternities and create a supportive and strong multicultural Greek community by promoting success in higher education, increasing diversity and multicultural awareness, and developing philanthro...
fullDescription: The MCG mission is to unite multicultural sororities and fraternities and create a supportive and strong multicultural Greek community by promoting success in higher education, increasing diversity and multicultural awareness, and developing philanthropic activities.
twitterDescription: We are the Multicultural Greek Council at UT, dedicated to leadership, community service, and multicultural issues, and striving to celebrate diversity at UT.

title: National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) On Campus at University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: In conjunction with the National Alliance on Mental Illness, National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) On Campus at the University of Texas at Austin seeks to educate the community on mental health conditions and support those affected by them.
fullDescription: Since the fall of 2016, we have been working to advocate for mental health and end the stigma against mental illness on campus and in our community.¬†Together we can be the difference. Check out our Facebook group, which is the best way to see updated announcements and events on the schedule.
twitterDescription: Official twitter for NAMI on Campus UT Austin! Here to #BreakTheStigma and create dialogue about mental health! Student-led, student-run

fullDescription: 1) Encourage professional interest among students in the study of nor- mal and disordered human communication behavior; 2) provide a vehicle for student representation in matters of professional concern; 3) provide continuity to the dissemination of professional information; 4) promote interaction between faculty and students, graduates and undergraduates, and student speech pathologists and audiologists.

title: Native American & Indigenous Collective
descriptionSnippet: NAIC is a student led organization with the principles of native empowerment, research, transnational and intertribal unity, scholarship and community.
fullDescription: The Native American and Indigenous Collective (NAIC)¬†arises from the merging of the Longhorn American Indian Council (LAIC) and the Native American & Indigenous Student Assembly (NAISA.)¬†NAIC is a student led organization with the principles of native empowerment, research, transnational and intertribal unity, scholarship and community.¬†The merging of these two groups celebrates the different indigenous identities across the four directions and seeks to create consciousness about our indigenous roots as we continue to fight for the survival of our cultures.
twitterDescription: Native American & Indigenous Collective. We focus on the issues of indigenous students of Texas, while forming alliances and networks with the community.

title: Natural Sciences Council
descriptionSnippet: Natural Sciences Council was founded in 1972 to serve as a liaison between the students and the faculty in the College of Natural Sciences (CNS). We work with the college and its students to create resources and improve the CNS student experience.
fullDescription: Natural Sciences Council was founded in 1972 to serve as a liaison between the students and the faculty in the College of Natural Sciences (CNS). We help direct feedback of programs in the college and work to resolve the problems students face in their daily academic and social communities. Through our events and programs, we connect students to the resources they need to succeed here and beyond, including campus entities, students of similar interests, faculty members, and organizations around UT and Austin. We constantly seek feedback from CNS students regarding functions and programs in the college and focus on how we can improve in order to better enhance the CNS student experience.
twitterDescription: Natural Sciences Council serves as the official liaison between the students and administration of the College of Natural Sciences.

title: New Student Services
descriptionSnippet: New Student Services spearheads orientation for thousands of freshmen and transfer students each year, ensuring they successfully transition to campus and register for classes.
fullDescription: New Student Services spearheads orientation for thousands of freshmen and transfer students each year, ensuring they successfully transition to campus and register for classes. The department also leads programs to promote student engagement, academic success and student leadership opportunities throughout the year.

title: Omega Delta Phi Fraternity, Inc.
descriptionSnippet: Omega Delta Phi is a multicultural service/social fraternity that upholds and promotes the principles of Unity, Honesty, Integrity and Leadership.
fullDescription: Omega Delta Phi is a multicultural service/social fraternity that upholds and promotes the principles of Unity, Honesty, Integrity and Leadership. Established in 1987 at Texas Tech University, it has grown to 78 entities, including the Chi chapter at the University of Texas at Austin. For more information regarding our fraternity, Greek Life, or answers to questions you may have as new students on campus, feel welcomed to e-mail us at president.chi@omegadeltaphi.org.

title: Omega Phi Alpha National Service Sorority
descriptionSnippet: Our mission is service. We provide opportunities for leadership and friendship through training and participation in service activities. Our hope is that our members will become life-long, service-minded leaders. We strive to better the lives of others.
fullDescription: The mission of Omega Phi Alpha is service. We provide opportunities for leadership and friendship through training and participation in service activities. Our hope is that our members will become life-long, service-minded leaders. We strive to better the lives of others worldwide by collaborating with organizations and volunteering through a flexible service program.

title: One Note Stand
descriptionSnippet: One Note Stand is an a cappella group whose mission is to serve the Austin community through music.
fullDescription: One Note Stand is a nationally recognized competitive a cappella group that enjoys singing on and around the UT campus. Originally founded as a service organization, ONS¬†continues to hold true to their roots by¬†giving free performances to charity events and fundraisers while also focusing on improving musically and making a name for themselves in the national a cappella community.
twitterDescription: A competitive co-ed a cappella group at UT Austin! Our mission: to sing real good and look real cute.

title: OneWay South Asian InterVarsity

title: Orange Bike Project
descriptionSnippet: The Orange Bike Project is UT's community bike shop where students can volunteer, learn, and work on their own bikes. We have the tools and expertise to teach you to work on your own. Need a bike repair, daily, or semester rentals? We'll help you out!
fullDescription:
The University of Texas at Austin's Community Bike Workshop and Rental.
OBP runs a competitive daily and semester bicycle rental and a community bike workshop.

UT student, staff and affiliates are welcome to come in and volunteer, fix and maintain their bikes and learn more about bicycles and cycling.¬†

Bicycles in the rental fleet are rented to UT students and staff both on a semester long basis and a daily basis.¬†

Bikes in the daily rental program are high quality Commuter/Hybrid bicycles that are great for errands, group outings, class field trips and more! They can be rented for a small daily, weekend or weekly fee by UT students and staff.

For detailed information on all of the above and more, please visit our official page:http://www.utexas.edu/parking/bike/orange.html

We are located in the 27th Street Garage. Come in through the parking lot on the ground floor and listen for the music!
twitterDescription: UT's community bike workshop and rental. Located at 27th Street Garage (TSG). E-mail us: orangebike.atx@gmail.com

title: Oxfam at the University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: Oxfam is dedicated to finding and promoting lasting solutions to global poverty, hunger, and social injustice.
fullDescription: Oxfam is dedicated to finding and promoting lasting solutions to global poverty, hunger, and social injustice. We educate the student body about issues such as fair trade and extractive sectors as well as participate in community activism to create lasting change.
twitterDescription: Ending poverty and hunger through service, education, and social change at the University of Texas and beyond-- oxfamut@gmail.com

title: Pagan Student Alliance
descriptionSnippet: To provide a forum and support network for people of alternative faiths and to facilitate interfaith dialogue across the campus....
fullDescription:
The Pagan Student Alliance at UT Austin is a support organization for people of alternative religions, loosely focusing¬†on a spectrum of polytheistic and earth or nature based faith-systems, and a forum for interfaith discussions. We seek to provide a venue in which to explore various aspects of these systems as well as to host social functions, rituals, and philanthropy events and initiatives. We also seek to increase the Pagan presence on campus and in the wider Austin community, as well as a myriad of other initiatives as deemed fit by the student membership.¬†

Everyone is welcome, as long as they remain respectful of other participants.

title: Palestine Solidarity Committee
descriptionSnippet: To promote education, discourse, activism, and awareness of the Palestinian struggle for freedom from oppression and occupation....
fullDescription: The Palestine Solidarity Committee is a student organization at the University of Texas at Austin dedicated to telling the story of the Palestinian struggle for justice and self-determination on the university campus and in the wider Austin community. We work to promote education, discourse, activism, and awareness of the Palestinian story through lectures by academics and political activists, movie screenings, and events and displays on the UT West Mall.

title: PALS (Partnership to Advance Language Study & Cultural)
descriptionSnippet: The PALS Program brings International and American students together for cultural exchange and to practice conversation skills. We carefully match one another based on their interests in language and hobbies.
fullDescription: The PALS Program brings International and American students together for cultural exchange and to practice conversation skills. We carefully¬†match one another based on their interests in language and hobbies. We develop and plan fun events to promote an inclusive environment on UT campus. Our events have included a trip to Barton Springs, bowling night, game night, and a tie-dye activity. At PALS we want to make sure every student coming into our organization has the opportunity to hang out with their PAL along with mingling with other students in the organization. Members of the UT Austin and International communities are welcome to apply.

title: Phi Beta Chi - Professional Women's Business Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: As the first professional women's organization at UT, Phi Beta Chi offers its members the opportunity to develop themselves as professional women, while also volunteering in the community, and enjoying their time together at exciting social events!
fullDescription: The goal of Phi Beta Chi is to promote the women of the University of Texas at Austin in the professional world by encouraging academic achievement, leadership skills, and fraternal relations; and by easing the transition from college students to career women.
twitterDescription: UT Austin's first & only professional women's business fraternity, founded in 1973 through the McCombs Business School || Instagram: txpbx

title: Phi Kappa Sigma
descriptionSnippet: The Objects of Phi Kappa Sigma fraternity shall be the promotion of good fellowship and the cultivation of the social virtues among our members; the protection of just rights and the advancement of the best interests, present and future, individual and...
fullDescription: The Objects of Phi Kappa Sigma fraternity shall be the promotion of good fellowship and the cultivation of the social virtues among our members; the protection of just rights and the advancement of the best interests, present and future, individual and collective, of all those who shall be associated together as members of this fraternity; the encouragement of good scholarship and the breadth of training for our members; and cooperation in the educational and cultural programs of institutions of higher education in which our chapters are located.

title: Pi Lambda Chi Latina Sorority, Inc. - Eta Chapter
descriptionSnippet: The mission of Pi Lambda Chi is to create a strong Sisterhood and an educational support network for women on college campuses. Pi Lambda Chi seeks to preserve Latina/Latino culture and history as well as promote education and community service.
fullDescription: An important aspect of our Sorority is that women of all ethnicities are welcome to join our Sisterhood and share the experience of being a Sister. We don‚Äôt turn any woman away because of race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or socioeconomic status. We love the diversity our Sorority has. We have Sisters represented worldwide; from California to Jersey, Nepal to Peru. We don‚Äôt choose our Sisters, our Sisters choose us.

title: Precious Plastic Texas
descriptionSnippet: We're a team of engineers, creators, designers, and thinkers looking to set up the Precious Plastic recycling process here at UT. We're always looking for some great people to join the fight against plastic pollution!
fullDescription: Precious Plastic Texas is the University of Texas chapter of an international grassroots movement with a mission to educate and empower individuals and communities to re-purpose single use plastic consumer waste, a vast majority of which piles up in landfills. Rather than viewing plastic as trash, we consider it a precious resource. PPTX is dedicated to helping create a circular economy of plastics in Austin and implement the Office of Sustainability‚Äôs Zero-Waste program. We enable plastic recycling efforts by building small-scale plastic re-processing and production machines based on open-source engineering designs to convert plastic waste into new, usable products.

descriptionSnippet: Texas PRSSA is one of the largest chapters in the nation with more than 150 members. The focus of our chapter is to provide an out-of-the-classroom experience that gives students an enhanced knowledge of the public relations field. Go to texasprssa.com
fullDescription: Texas¬†PRSSA ‚Äì Dr. Alan Scott Chapter is one of the largest chapters in the nation with more than¬†150 members. The focus of our chapter is to provide an out-of-the-classroom experience that gives students, regardless of their major, an enhanced knowledge of the public relations field. Our focus on professional development, engagement and philanthropy is centered on the success of our members.

title: School of Human Ecology
descriptionSnippet: We are human development and family sciences, nutritional sciences and textiles and apparel. We are science based and human focused.

title: Senate of College Councils
descriptionSnippet: To serve as the official voice of students in academic affairs through representation by the College Councils.
fullDescription: To serve as the official voice of students in academic affairs through representation by the College Councils. The members of Senate value the opportunities the University of Texas at Austin has to offer, and strives to make them publicized, expanded, and improved for the students on the 40 acres. Senate deals with issues like plus/minus grading, teacher evaluations, study abroad, core curriculum streams, advising, and tuition regulation, all on a hands-on level.

title: Sigma Alpha Iota International Music Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: Sigma Alpha Iota is an international fraternity which promotes interaction among those who share a commitment to and love for music. Members of SAI are active in all areas of campus music and campus life.
fullDescription:
SAI is an organization which promotes interaction among those who share a commitment to music. Members of SAI are active in all areas of campus music and campus life, working closely with faculty, administration, campus and community groups, music professionals and patrons.¬†

title: Sigma Delta Lambda Sorority, Inc.
descriptionSnippet: Sigma Delta Lambda-Beta Chapter is a multicultural service and social organization designed to help through tutoring and mentoring the youth of the Austin community. We're also committed to uniting Latinas on the UT campus and building lifelong contacts.
fullDescription: Sigma Delta Lambda-Beta Chapter is a multicultural service and social organization designed to help, through tutoring and mentoring, the youth of the Austin community. While we are committed to helping students in the Austin area, we are also committed to uniting Latinas on the UT campus, and building contacts that will last a lifetime.

title: Sigma Delta Tau
descriptionSnippet: It shall be the purpose of this fraternal organization to form a close social and fraternal union of those of similar ideals and to foster, maintain, and instill such ideals in the hearts of its members as well as result in actions worthy of the highes...
fullDescription: It shall be the purpose of this fraternal organization to form a close social and fraternal union of those of similar ideals and to foster, maintain, and instill such ideals in the hearts of its members as well as result in actions worthy of the highest precepts of true womanhood, democracy and humanity.

title: Sigma Lambda Alpha Sorority, Inc.
descriptionSnippet: Sigma Lambda Alpha is an organization built on service, academics, loyalty, culture, and sisterhood. We are dedicated to excelling the Latinx community not only at the University of Texas at Austin, but our society as whole.
fullDescription: The mission of Sigma Lambda Alpha Sorority, Inc. is to promote the importance of community service involvement and academic achievement as well as to educate and excel the stance of Latinx cultures in this diversely enriched campus.

title: Sigma Lambda Gamma National Sorority
descriptionSnippet: Sigma Lambda Gamma, historically a Latina based sorority, shall be primarily one of promoting standards of excellence in morality, ethics and education.
fullDescription: The purpose of Sigma Lambda Gamma, historically a Latina based sorority, shall be primarily one of promoting standards of excellence in morality, ethics and education. Further, the sorority shall work to better serve the needs and wants of all people by disseminating information about the diverse culture which we all share. Finally, the sorority shall maintain respect for the views of others through this valuing, thereby, enhancing our understanding of one another, and thus bettering our community, our country, and the world.

title: Silk Club
descriptionSnippet: Silk Club is an Austin-based organization for self-identified Asian womxn/non-binary folks/ femmes+ to collaborate on creative projects that celebrate our experience.
fullDescription: Silk Club is an organization for Austin-based self-identified Asian American womxn/non-binary folks/femmes+ to collaborate on projects that celebrate our experience. It is a space committed to validating and empowering intersectional identities, building creative opportunities, and fostering connections between different Asian communities.

title: Society of American Archivists
descriptionSnippet: To serve as a means of introducing and integrating new archivists into the profession; to enhance the educational function of the Society by providing focus for students to discuss archival issues, identify with profession and engage in professional ac...
fullDescription: To serve as a means of introducing and integrating new archivists into the profession; to enhance the educational function of the Society by providing focus for students to discuss archival issues, identify with profession and engage in professional activities to promote communia tion among student members; to develop the leaders of tommorrow's archival profession; and to attract new members into the Society of American Archivists.

title: Society of Plastics Engineers at the University of Texas
descriptionSnippet: Society of Plastics Engineers at the University of Texas is the first student chapter at UT to represent the largest global network of plastics professionals representing 84 countries and 22,500+ members.
fullDescription: Society of Plastics Engineers at the University of Texas is the first student chapter at UT to represent the largest global network of plastics professionals representing 84 countries and 22,500+ members. PETX aims to enhance the academic and professional careers of students interested in the plastics/polymer industry. We promote scientific and engineering knowledge relating to plastics and polymers. We invite professionals for a bimonthly seminar series so students can gain perspective about the challenges, opportunities, and career paths in the plastics industry. We also organize industrial tours and attend the annual SPE plastics conference. One of our core tenets is sustainability and as such, we are the first plastics community in Austin with a large international network of industry/academic professionals engaged in sustainable plastic use. Our goal is to engage dialogue between industry practitioners, professors, and students to shape the future of global sustainable plastics production from an industrial standpoint.
twitterDescription: The Society of Plastics Engineers at the University of Texas promotes knowledge relating to plastics manufacturing and advances student careers.
tweets: undefined@UTAustin Society of Plastics Engineers student chapter attends the 2019 International Polyolefins Conference in Ho‚Ä¶ https://t.co/RhLfiuHs3s

title: Socks for the Sole

fullDescription: Socks for the Sole is a student-led nonprofit organization aimed at providing new pairs of socks to the homeless of Austin. By doing so, we will raise awareness about the struggles faced by people who suffer from homelessness within our own community, and work through fundraising and service events to have an impact on their lives.

title: Spitshine Poetry
descriptionSnippet: We want to create a community of writers who use poetry to better themselves and others....
fullDescription: We want to create a community of writers who use poetry to better themselves and others. We see poetry as a tool that empowers the individual. Everyone has a story, and at Spitshine, we aim to find those stories by giving voices to those who have been silenced and providing a stage (literally and figuratively) for them to spit.
twitterDescription: UTexas's official & only poetry organization. 2014 College Union Poetry Slam champions. Workshops @ 7pm every Thurs, WAG 112. All levels welcome!

title: Student Activities
descriptionSnippet: Student Activities in the Office of the Dean of Students provides services to support to the over 1,200 registered student organizations on campus.
fullDescription: Student Activities in the Office of the Dean of Students provides several services to support to the over 1,200 registered student organizations on campus. Student Activities offers many services to student organizations, providing information through its publications, training through its workshops, one-on-one consultations and event planning support.

title: Student Emergency Services
descriptionSnippet: Student Emergency Services, in the Office of the Dean of Students, works with campus and community organizations to provide a number of services to assist students, and in some cases their families and friends, during an emergency or crisis situation.
fullDescription: Student Emergency Services assists students with different types of emergencies, including student deaths, death of a relative, family emergencies, attempted suicide, student illness/injury, interpersonal violence or stalking, sexual assault,¬† missing students, apartment or house fire, natural disaster, financial problems, and concerns about academic adjustment or performance.
twitterDescription: Anchoring our work within the student experience, we create evolving and dynamic learning opportunities through research, leadership, partnership and change.

title: Student Engineering Council
descriptionSnippet: The Student Engineering Council, or SEC, is an organization composed of engineering students whose purpose is to represent students of the Cockrell School of Engineering on campus and in the surrounding communities.
fullDescription: The Student Engineering Council (SEC) is an organization composed of engineering students whose purpose is to represent students of the Cockrell School of Engineering on campus and in the surrounding communities. As the umbrella student organization of the Cockrell School of Engineering, all of our initiatives are aimed at involving the widest demographic of engineering students.

title: Student National Pharmaceutical Association
descriptionSnippet: The Student National Pharmaceutical Association is an education and service association of pharmacy students and high school affiliate members, concerned about pharmacy and other health professions.
fullDescription: The Student National Pharmaceutical Association is an education and service association of pharmacy students and high school affiliate members, concerned about pharmacy and other health professions with a focus on minority students and communities. The purpose of SNPhA is to plan, organize, coordinate, and execute programs geared toward improvement of the health, social, and educational environment of the community; while providing opportunities for professional development.

title: Student Veteran Center
descriptionSnippet: UT Austin SVC is a lounge and meeting space where student veterans can study, socialize and relax between classes. Equipped with Wi-Fi access, a public computer workstation and a flat screen television, the center offers events and programs for veterans.
fullDescription: UT Austin's Student Veteran Center is a lounge and meeting space where student veterans can study, socialize and relax between classes. Equipped with Wi-Fi access, a public computer workstation and a flat screen television, the center offers events and programs specifically for student veterans. Come visit us on the fourth floor of the Student Services Building (SSB), 4.472.

title: Students Fighting Climate Change

twitterDescription: Organization focused on educating our community about the impacts of climate change üåé Get involved and join the fight to #SaveOurFuture

title: Students for Equity and Diversity
descriptionSnippet: We seek to promote awareness and appreciation of self by creating inclusive spaces through interactive workshops, peer facilitated dialogue, and program that focus on social justice issue prevalent in our society. We a sponsored organization of the MEC.
fullDescription: SED was established with the sole purpose of designing and implementing diversity education programs for all students. title: Study Abroad
descriptionSnippet: Study abroad changes lives, and the work of Study Abroad at the University of Texas is guided by our commitment to promoting access to study abroad opportunities for our diverse population of students.
fullDescription: Our mission is to provide outreach, service, and support to students considering or committed to studying abroad. We accomplish this by partnering with faculty and staff to facilitate participation through integration into the curriculum, and by continuously seeking ways to improve our own practices to better serve students and the University.¬† Our vision is that all UT students who are interested in and eligible to study abroad will have the opportunity to do so.

title: Take the Wheel Productions
descriptionSnippet: Take the Wheel Productions is a student-run production company that will create, develop and produce original student work for both the stage and screen.
fullDescription: Take the Wheel Productions is a student-run production company that creates, develops, and produces student work for both the stage and screen. Our organization works collaboratively to bring stage and screen projects to life each semester, based off ideas pitched by members. Whether you want to produce an original piece of work, or have dreamed of staging your own production of a beloved show or musical, Take the Wheel Productions can help you realize your goal.

title: Texas 4000 for Cancer
descriptionSnippet: Texas 4000 is dedicated to fighting cancer by sharing hope, knowledge, and charity. We cultivate the next generation to lead the fight against cancer through our cornerstone event, a more than 4,000-mile bike ride from Austin to Anchorage....

title: Texas Aerial Robotics
descriptionSnippet: We are a competition aerial robotics team, dedicated to competing in the International Aerial Robotics Competition.
fullDescription: We are a competition aerial robotics team, dedicated to competing in the International Aerial Robotics Competition (IARC). IARC challenges us to solve cutting edge problems in the field of aerial robotics such as GPS denied navigation, obstacle avoidance and real-time dynamic decision making all in full autonomy.¬† To learn more please visit our website:¬†http://www.texasaerialrobotics.com/.
twitterDescription: We are an organization dedicated to pushing the line of aerial autonomous motion with an end goal of competing on an international stage for UT Austin.

title: Texas Angels
descriptionSnippet: Texas Angels is a social, spirit and service organization that is dedicated to philanthropy, school spirit, academics, and sisterhood.
fullDescription: Texas Angels was established at the University of Texas at Austin in 2014. The vision of the original founders was to create a strong sisterhood that would uphold the four pillars: social, scholastic, spirit, and service. ¬†These collectively represent the core values held at the heart of the Texas Angels. Texas Angels works to create a positive impact in the Austin Community and our chosen philanthropy, the Miracle Foundation. Angels also support the University in all of its organizations, from the arts to athletics. This organization empowers is members through positive affirmations and inspires fellow Angels to be the best they can be. By providing a network of support and sisterhood, Texas Angels promotes social and personal growth within the organization.

title: Texas Ballroom
descriptionSnippet: To provide an opportunity to learn and improve the art of Ballroom dancing in a lively social atmosphere....
fullDescription: The mission of Texas Ballroom is to provide an opportunity to learn and improve the art of Ballroom dancing in a lively social atmosphere. We provide regular practice sessions and opportunities to dance through social functions and formal dance events. We also have competitive teams for country dancing and ballroom dancing that compete across the nation.

title: Texas Bhangra
descriptionSnippet: Texas Bhangra is a nationally competing bhangra team from UT Austin! We, not only represent Austin, but we are one of the oldest and leading collegiate teams in Texas and we represent our state in national and international competitions!
fullDescription: Texas Bhangra was formed at The University of Texas at Austin in 2003 with a very distinct vision: to promote awareness of Punjabi culture through dance and the importance of diversity and multiculturalism. We perform the dance style of Bhangra, a high energy, fast paced dance form originating from the Punjab region in North India/Pakistan. Bhangra originated as a dance celebrating the harvest season each year in the villages and we strive to maintain the spirit in which Bhangra was performed. We accomplish these goals by performing at numerous charity and cultural events for both our campus and the community at large. Our team is known for our energy both on and off stage; we are driven to inspire others with our passion, dedication, and unique style.
twitterDescription:
UT Austin's Premier Bhangra team. 
Austin, Texas

title: Texas Blockchain
descriptionSnippet: Our mission is to promote the education and research of distributed ledger technology through student collaboration, while cultivating innovation within The University of Texas by exploring applications of blockchain across varying industries.
fullDescription: Texas Blockchain Group is a student-run organization at UT Austin that is dedicated to research and education of distributed ledger technology systems. Our team consists of students from a variety of backgrounds such as Computer Science, Engineering, Business, Economics, and more. Our goal is to find new applications of blockchain technology throughout the various industries that our team has experience in as well as encouraging personal development of our members in the blockchain industry.
twitterDescription: A student org dedicated to the research, development, and education of blockchain tech and its applications ü§ò

title: Texas Bluebonnets
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the Texas Bluebonnets is to unite diverse UT students through service, social, and spirit events. The Texas Bluebonnets' main focus is on leadership and character development.
fullDescription: Texas Bluebonnets is a spirit organization on campus. Founded with character as our core pillar, we hope to improve ourselves and our community through our philanthropic efforts with the¬†Austin Animal Center¬†and other service projects in the Austin community area. In addition, Bluebonnets are dedicated to academia and strive to be excellent students and mentors. We are also proud of attending the prestigious institution of UT Austin and wholeheartedly support our university with our Longhorn spirit. Most importantly, we support our members by incorporating a sisterhood of strong, long-lasting friendships.
twitterDescription: Character. Leadership. Academics. Service. Spirit. Since 2014.

title: Texas Business Healthcare Association
descriptionSnippet: The University of Texas at Austin's Texas Business Healthcare Association is a student organization dealing with business, healthcare and student involvement. TXBHA is open to all members.
fullDescription: Texas Business Healthcare Association is an organization within the McCombs School of Business at The University of Texas at Austin. TXBHA is focused on filling in the gap between business and healthcare by exposing students to the financial, managerial, legal, and consulting aspects of the healthcare industry. Each semester, TXBHA curates a series of speakers to provide insight on these topics, in addition to providing community service opportunities and organizing social events. Membership is open to all UT students interested in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy or business.

title: Texas Challah For Hunger
descriptionSnippet: Challah for Hunger is a national non-profit that raises money and awareness for hunger and disaster relief both locally and globally, through the production and sale of challah bread.
fullDescription: Challah for Hunger is a national non-profit that raises money and awareness for hunger and disaster relief both locally and globally, through the production and sale of challah bread. The UT chapter meets weekly at the Texas Hillel on 21st and San Antonio from 5:30-7:00 on Tuesdays to braid the challah, and then it is baked fresh on Wenesday and sold on the West Mall starting at 12. Proceeds from the sale benefit the Capitol Area Food Bank and Mazon. Challah for Hunger is a non-denominational organization and welcomes volunteers of all backgrounds and ages!

title: Texas Darlins
descriptionSnippet: Texas Darlins is an organization bound by sisterhood, driven by service, and unparalleled in spirit. We unite every kind of woman with the aim of changing our community and altering ourselves through service and spirit.
fullDescription: Established in 2003, Texas Darlins is an organization bound by sisterhood, driven by service, and unparalleled in spirit. As the official spirit group of the Texas Men's and Women's basketball programs, we unite every kind of woman with the aim of changing our community and altering ourselves through service and spirit. Embedded in each of us are the qualities that make a strong leader, devotion, kindness, loyalty, determination, and grace. We are a group of individuals move as one toward a common goal: unity in service, sisterhood, and spirit.
twitterDescription: The official spirit group for Texas Men‚Äôs and Women‚Äôs Basketball at the University of Texas at Austin! Spirit ‚Ä¢ Service ‚Ä¢ Sisterhood

title: Texas Data Science Association
descriptionSnippet: The Texas Data Science Association brings together students with an interest in big data, data analytics, and data science. Our goal is to develop students into future leaders who will excel in changing the world through the use of data.
fullDescription: TDSA is an organization for students that are interested in a career big data, data analytics, and data science. Our goal is to help students develop the skills necessary for a career involving data. Our foundation is built upon four pillars: professional, social, philanthropic, and academic.

title: Texas Dragon/Lion Dance Team
descriptionSnippet: Our goal is to share and introduce the art of lion dancing throughout the community.
fullDescription: The Texas Dragon/Lion Dance Team (TDDT) is a performance-driven lion dance group based in Austin, Texas. Our goal is to share and,¬† in many cases, introduce the art of lion dancing to the community. We are one of the few teams in Central Texas that performs year-round, for a wide variety of events. In the past we've performed for elementary schools, cultural events, festivals, restaurants, and weddings. Our prime performance season is during the Lunar New Year (early February or March) where we perform the gauntlet of back-to-back performances for businesses and organizations all over Austin.
twitterDescription: Texas Dragon/Lion Dance Team - Speading the art of lion dance to Austin and Central Texas.

title: Texas Electronic Music Club
descriptionSnippet: We're a UT student organization that aims to build a community for electronic music listeners, producers, and DJ's! This is an ideal place to share information about all things EDM related: music, projects, parties, and more!
fullDescription: We're a UT student organization that will aim to build a community for electronic music listeners, producers, and DJ's! An ideal place to share information about all things EDM related: music, projects, parties, and more! Providing a way aspiring artists to meet and collaborate on audio projects and DJ mixes. Functioning as both a social and educational organization dedicated to audio technology and dance music culture.
twitterDescription: UT Austin student organization for aspiring DJs, producers, EDM lovers, flow artists, and more!

title: Texas Engineering World Health
descriptionSnippet: Hello! Welcome to our HornsLink page. Please visit our main website at texasewh.org for more information about us.
fullDescription: Using engineering innovation to create medical devices for the developing world
twitterDescription: The University of Texas branch of Engineering World Health. Designing medical solutions for the developing world.

title: Texas Environmental Law Journal
descriptionSnippet: The Texas Environmental Law Journal is produced for publication by a select group of students of the University of Texas School of Law, in association with the Environmental and Natural Resources Law Section of the State Bar of Texas.
fullDescription:
What Does TELJ Publish?
TELJ is a biannual publication that provides practitioners with current legal articles, developments, and information pertaining to environmental and natural resources law, as well as news of activities and other relevant events.

title: Texas Girl Gang
descriptionSnippet: Empowering women personally, professionally, and politically through workshops and speakers.
fullDescription: Texas Girl Gang wants to help female-identifying students on UT's campus become their best selves! Come join us to learn how to achieve more in your personal, professional, and political lives through various workshops and speakers. We also host social events (like brunch and Galentine's day!) and volunteer opportunities, so that you can connect with other #girlbosses and serve the greater Austin community!

title: Texas Gymnastics
descriptionSnippet: Texas Gymnastics is a competitive club that offers an opportunity for members to improve skills in artistic gymnastics, and to provide an opportunity for men and women to compete in gymnastics at the national club level.
fullDescription: Texas Gymnastics is a competitive club that offers an opportunity¬†for members to improve skills in artistic gymnastics, and to provide an opportunity for men and women to compete in gymnastics at the national club level. ¬†Our competitions begin in the Spring, so don't forget to¬†visit our website or like us on Facebook in order to stay up to date with our meet schedule.

title: Texas Handball
descriptionSnippet: 1) Promote handball at The University of Texas and beyond; 2) sponsor a competitive handball team and assist its members financially at competitions (e.g., entry fees, lodging, etc.); 3) when possible, provide team members with equipment and uniforms
fullDescription: 1) Promote handball at The University of Texas and beyond; 2) sponsor a competitive handball team and assist its members financially at competitions (e.g., entry fees, lodging, etc.); 3) continually increase participation in the four tournaments we host each year; 4) administer a successful 2020 Collegiate Nationals to be held at UT
twitterDescription: Fourth-ranked collegiate handball program in the world. 2016 Women's National Champions.  Hook 'em horns!

title: Texas Ice Hockey
descriptionSnippet: To provide the students and faculty of the University of Texas the opportunity to watch or play the sport of Ice Hockey and to improve the ability and skills of those who play. We are students first and strive to be successful off and on the ice.
fullDescription: The University of Texas Ice Hockey Team is part of the Division 2 of the American Collegiate Hockey Association. We represent the University of Texas as we play other schools around the state and the country. if you are interested in joining our program feel free to contact us with the information bellow.

title: Texas Infinites
descriptionSnippet: Texas Infinites is a co-ed spirit group at The University of Texas at Austin founded in 2013. The mission of this organization is to create a diverse family for students on campus and build moral character.
fullDescription: Texas Infinites is a co-ed spirit group at The University of Texas at Austin founded in 2013. The mission of this organization is to create a diverse family for students on campus and build moral character through service. Texas Infinites strives to support and serve the University's community by dedicating itself to uphold the three pillars that build the foundation of the organization: Service, Social, and Spirit.
twitterDescription: Est. 2013 at UT Austin. CO-ED service, social, & spirit group. Stay tuned for the Spring ‚Äò19 recruitment season!

title: Texas Interdisciplinary Plan Community Outreach
descriptionSnippet: We are a group of Natural Science students who are dedicated to serving our community and making a positive impact on the lives of others through service.
fullDescription: Members of TIPCO devote their time and energy volunteering for various Austin organizations throughout the school year.

title: Texas Journal of Oil, Gas & Energy Law
descriptionSnippet: The Texas Journal of Oil, Gas, and Energy Law's (TJOGEL) vision is to be a leading energy law journal. We want to be the forum of choice for energy law practitioners, professors, and students around the globe. Our focus centers on providing significant..
fullDescription: The Texas Journal of Oil, Gas, and Energy Law's (TJOGEL) vision is to be a leading energy law journal. We want to be the forum of choice for energy law practitioners, professors, and students around the globe. Our mission is to provide energy professionals with relevant information on emerging issues in the dynamic field of oil, gas, and energy law, while cultivating the industry's future leaders.
twitterDescription: The Texas Journal of Oil, Gas, & Energy Law is the leading energy law journal published biannually by students at @UTexasLaw.

title: Texas Ladies
descriptionSnippet: The Texas Ladies are the newest, loudest, proudest spirit group on campus. We differ from other groups in that we offer pre-professional service opportunities; namely pre-medical, pre-law, and business. Join us as we serve, lead, and conquer!
fullDescription: The Texas Ladies are the newest, loudest, proudest spirit group on campus. We differ from other groups in that we offer pre-professional service opportunities; namely pre-medical, pre-law, and business. We work with¬† UHS, Travis County Courthouse, and more! The Ladies take a new approach to club leadership: rather than the traditional democratic system, the Ladies have a CEO and Board of Directors to teach our¬†members business functions and encourage them to reach for leadership positions in their life outside the group as well. Like any other spirit group, our core values are social, spirit, and service. We host many social events and love UT sports.¬†Join us as we serve, lead, and conquer!

title: Texas Ladybirds
descriptionSnippet: Texas Ladybirds is a spirit organization at the University of Texas at Austin founded in memory of Lady Bird Johnston. We strive to uphold our pillars of service, spirit, scholarship, and social.
fullDescription: The Texas Ladybirds is a spirit organization at the University of Texas at Austin, founded to foster lifelong friendships between high-caliber people and to inspire them to uphold the legacy of Lady Bird Johnson.¬†We were founded in Fall of 2014 for people ready to make a change in the world. Each of our members are held to high standards of excellence and participate in many spirit, social, service and scholarship events throughout each semester.
twitterDescription: Spirit Group at The University of Texas at Austin striving to live in Lady Bird Johnson's memory.

title: Texas Lonestars
descriptionSnippet: Texas Lonestars is a group of women at UT dedicated to the pillars of service, spirit, and sisterhood. Lonestars share a special bond through their love of the university and serving their community.
fullDescription: Texas Lonestars is a group of women at UT dedicated to the pillars of service, spirit, and sisterhood. Each year, the Lonestars contribute hundreds of hours to community service events. The Lonestars truly bleed burnt orange! Whether it be cheering on the Horns from their group seats at football games, marching in the OU Parade, or playing intramural sports, Lonestars have spirit in every sense of the word. Lonestars is more than just an extra curricular activity- its a family. This close-knit organization provides a home away from home for its members.
twitterDescription: Texas Lonestars is a registered student organization at the University of Texas dedicated to service, spirit, and sisterhood.  Hook 'em and #LL!

title: Texas Pearls

title: Texas Performing Arts
descriptionSnippet: Texas Performing Arts serves The University of Texas at Austin campus and the Austin community at large through a diverse season of international performances, campus and community engagement activities, and collaborative partnerships.
fullDescription: Texas Performing Arts serves The University of Texas at Austin campus and the Austin community at large through a diverse season of international performances, campus and community engagement activities, and collaborative partnerships. Performances include classical music, jazz, world music, modern and international dance, and conversation. Comprised of six state-of-the-art theatres, Texas Performing Arts presents, produces, and commissions global culture experiences otherwise unavailable locally to the Central Texas community.
twitterDescription: We've moved! Follow @tpapresents
tweets: undefinedFollow us at our new home on Twitter - @tpapresents!

title: Texas Phi Delta Epsilon
descriptionSnippet: Phi Delta Epsilon at the University of Texas is a Pre-Med coed fraternity. PhiDE Texas focuses on community service, friendship, prehealth opportunities, and leadership abilities. Our motto is Facta-Non-Verba: Deeds not words.
fullDescription:
Phi Delta Epsilon was founded over 100 years ago as a professional medical fraternity
supporting the need for camaraderie and mentoring among medical students. Since then, the
membership has changed dramatically but the mission and objectives of our organization
remain the same. PhiDE (pronounced F-eye Dee Eee) provides educational opportunities,
supports philanthropic projects, and serves as a foundation for the development of relationships
among medical professionals throughout the entire spectrum of a medical career.
Through a host of planned activities during the academic year, students develop their leadership
and professional skills, which complement a basic understanding of medical science. When the
time comes to apply for medical school or match for residency, active membership in PhiDE is
evidence of that a student is well rounded and motivated. In addition to our numerous resources
for the MCAT and USMLE, there are many chapter activities to help relieve the stress of
studying.
Since 1904, when our professional coeducational organization was founded, we are
continuously striving to meet the following objectives:
ÔÅ∂ To promote fellowship, equality, and unity.
ÔÅ∂ To promote the highest scientific and educational standards in the field of
medicine.
ÔÅ∂ To promote, uphold, and maintain the highest standards of ethics in the practice
of medicine, medical teaching, and research.
ÔÅ∂ To promote non-profit service to the community.
ÔÅ∂ To promote discussions at all Fraternity level of current social and economic
issues as related to medicine, the practice of medicine, and other health care
related matters.

title: Texas Political Union
descriptionSnippet: The Texas Political Union is a forum for political debate and discussion in a noncompetitive environment. Students from all parts of the political spectrum are welcome here to speak their mind on the issues and hone their public speaking skills.
fullDescription: The Texas Political Union is a forum for political debate and discussion in a noncompetitive environment. Students from all parts of the political spectrum are welcome here to speak their mind on the issues and hone their public speaking skills. We believe that civil¬†political discourse is essential¬†for civic engagement and leadership.¬†We also host outside and faculty speakers.

title: Texas Public Health
descriptionSnippet: Texas Public Health is open to students of all majors who are interested in public health. We hope to raise awareness on public health issues around the globe and foster strong ties of responsibility and dependability to our local Austin community.
fullDescription: Texas Public Health is the student organization representing students interested in health education, disease prevention, and the development of a strong public health initiative at the University of Texas at Austin.¬†The interdisciplinary field of public health combines biology, chemistry, medicine, and sociology. We provide information about graduate school, research opportunities around campus, and a vibrant community to explore public health.¬†At the University of Texas at Austin, the Public Health B.S. degree is broken into 6 concentrations:
twitterDescription: A professional student organization aimed to expose students to the wide, complex science of public health. We also explore career and graduate opportunities!

title: Texas Quidditch
descriptionSnippet: We play quidditch as sanctioned by United States Quidditch both inter-collegiately and intramurally. House practices are 6-8pm at Whitaker Fields on Wednesdays. Anyone is welcome to come out to a house practice and try it out.
fullDescription: Quidditch is a relatively new sport that is based on the sport from the Harry Potter series. ¬†The sport is a fast paced and physical game that involves bits and pieces from multiple sports including rugby, basketball, and dodgeball. Here at the University of Texas we have two traveling teams that compete intercollegiately with other teams from around the state and the country. We also have two intramural teams that compete once a month against each other.

title: Texas Raas
descriptionSnippet: Texas Raas (Dirty South Dandiya) is UT's very own nationally renowned Raas/Garba Dance Team. Each year we put together a garba/raas routine that we perform for local events as well as compete with at national competitions all around the country.
fullDescription: Founded in 2003, UT Austin's very own professional Garba/Raas dance team, Texas Raas, also known as Dirty South Dandiya, has been representing Texas for the past 13 years. Come support us at our local and national events every year! We perform not only on the UT campus but also at national-level competitions around the nation along with private parties such as weddings, receptions, etc.
twitterDescription: Founded in 2003, Texas Raas, aka Dirty South Dandiya, is UT Austin's very own professional Garba/Raas dance team. Who we be? DSD eboard@texasraas.org

title: Texas Review of Law and Politics
descriptionSnippet: The Unfettered Pursuit of Conservative Legal Scholarship
fullDescription: The Texas Review of Law and Politics is a premier conservative and libertarian law journal.¬†Our scholarship is at the forefront of conservative and libertarian legal thought and is routinely cited in opinions, scholarship, and the popular press. Our authors include federal and state judges, federal and state senators, governors, professors, policy experts, practicing attorneys, and leading law students. Our network includes the leading conservative legal minds in America at every level of professional success.

title: Texas Rotaract
descriptionSnippet: Texas Rotaract is the university chapter of Rotary International. We pride ourselves in ‚Äúservice above self,‚Äù service at home and overseas, and the creation of leaders.
fullDescription:
The Rotaract Club is the university chapter of Rotary International. We pride ourselves in ‚Äúservice above self,‚Äù service at home and overseas, and the creation of leaders. Our sponsoring Rotary club is the Austin University Area Rotary Club.

We are a service organization, both local and international. We also interact extensively with our Rotarians.

title: Texas Royals
descriptionSnippet: Texas Royals was formed in honor of Darrell K. Royal, and seeks to support all University of Texas sports as well as enhance the experience of its members through social, philanthropic, leadership, and spirit activities.
fullDescription: Texas Royals seeks to enhance the college experience of its members by involvement in social, philanthropic, leadership and spirit activities. The highest pillars of Texas Royals are to create lasting friendships and strengthen the individual's tie to The University of Texas at Austin, through both academics and campus engagement.
twitterDescription: We are a spirit group honoring the legacy of Darrell K Royal at The University of Texas. Live Royally!

title: Texas Sports Law Society
descriptionSnippet: A group of UT Law students that have an interest in sports law.
fullDescription: Texas Sports Law Society is a student organization for students at The University of Texas School of Law. TSLS is open to anyone who is interested in sports law, who is an aspiring sports agents, or who is just interested in sports in general.

title: Texas Student Media
descriptionSnippet: TSM is comprised of several student-produced media properties: The Daily Texan newspaper; the humor magazine Texas Travesty; the Cactus yearbook; KVRX 91.7 FM; Texas Student Television (TSTV), and BurntX.
fullDescription: Texas Student Media (TSM) is the main source for news on campus. TSM is composed of The Daily Texan newspaper, Texas Travesty, the Cactus Yearbook, KVRX 91.7 FM, TSTV-Texas Student Television, BurntX and the Advertising Department. All of these entities are run by students for students. It is a great place for students to get hands on, professional experience in a variety of communications fields that will help them succeed upon graduating from UT.

title: Texas Student Psychological Association
descriptionSnippet: Our mission is to involve students interested in psychology with opportunities available to them on and off campus.

title: Texas Student Television
descriptionSnippet: TSTV is UT's very own student-run TV station! We provide student volunteers an educational and creative outlet to produce cross-media programming, which entertains, educates and enriches the lives of the student body, Austin community and other audiences
fullDescription: Texas Student Television is the University of Texas at Austin's entirely student-run television station. TSTV broadcasts student-created content all across Austin, 24 hours a day. Students create all the content on TSTV, produce the shows, manage and maintain the equipment, and oversee the budget and daily operation of the station.
twitterDescription: The University of Texas at Austin's student-run, student-produced, FCC-licensed college television station. Dorm Ch. 15 & Antenna Ch. 29.1 | https://t.co/C03ERLbYgo

title: Texas Sweethearts
descriptionSnippet: Texas Sweethearts is an honorary service, spirit, and social student organization at the University of Texas at Austin. Members serve both the University and Austin community while promoting spirit throughout campus.
fullDescription: The Texas Sweethearts are a diverse group of young women dedicated to serving the Austin community and supporting University of Texas athletics. We strive to promote scholastic achievement, integrity, and leadership while fostering lifelong friendships among our Sweetheart sisters.
twitterDescription: Service, Spirit & Social Organization at UT Austin. Voted Best Student Organization (The Daily Texan) & Best Social Organization (UT Ethics & Leadership Board)

title: Texas THON
descriptionSnippet: Texas THON is a student-run philanthropy at The University of Texas that raises funds and awareness for Dell Children's Medical Center of Central Texas - our local Children's Miracle Network Hospital, right here in Austin.
fullDescription: Texas THON is a student-run philanthropy that raises awareness and funds for¬†Dell Children‚Äôs Medical Center of Central Texas¬†‚Äì our local Children‚Äôs Miracle Network Hospital. Texas THON unites the Austin community to help provide children with necessary medical treatment and serve all families, regardless of their ability to pay. We seek to help promote not only health but confidence in the lives of our Miracle Kids and their families. Our year-round fundraising efforts culminate in a 12-hour spring event where our Miracle Makers stand For The Kids (FTK!).
twitterDescription: Student-run philanthropy at @UTAustin. We raise funds and awareness #ForTheKids at @DellChildrens! #TheTimeIsNow

title: Texas Tower Communications
descriptionSnippet: A student-run communications firm working exclusively with non-profits in the Austin area.
fullDescription: Student run communications firm that exclusively helps a variety of nonprofits in the Austin area. Together we make up a community of driven students who seek to gain experience in the communications field while giving back to the community.

title: Texas Transfer Students
descriptionSnippet: Texas Transfer Students is an organization built by transfer students, for transfer students. Our goal is to make the transition to UT successful for new and returning transfer students.
fullDescription: We are Texas Transfer Students, a student organization at the University of Texas at Austin. We're an academic and¬†social club on campus created by transfer students, for transfer students, and our goal is to help others have an easy transition to UT. We want everyone to feel at home at such a big school and become¬†a part of the Longhorn community. With weekly socials, study nights, a mentorship program, and more, we aspire to help others meet new people and achieve their academic and personal goals while finding their UT family. Drop by one of our biweekly meetings or check out one of our many of events upcoming up, and come get to know us!
twitterDescription: Welcome to Texas Transfer Students, the most professional and hilariously fun transfer organization at the University of Texas at Austin.

title: Texas Trap and Skeet
descriptionSnippet: Our goal is to engage UT students and faculty in the recreational aspect of shotgun sports as well as to compete locally and nationally at a collegiate level as a shotgun shooting team....
fullDescription: Texas Trap and Skeet is a student run Rec Sport¬†at the University of Texas at Austin, that works to engage UT students and faculty in shotgun sports events with a focus on skeet, trap, sporting clays, and five stand. We have both casual and competitive members and send squads to compete at the local, state, and national levels.

title: Texas Triathlon
descriptionSnippet: Texas Triathlon is a club that provides consistent group workouts, training, and support for triathlon and endurance races.
fullDescription: Texas Triathlon is a club that provides consistent group workouts, training, and support for triathlon and endurance races.¬†We are a group of fun, health-conscious athletes¬†with various interests and backgrounds and¬†enjoy working out together. We also have a wide range of skill levels, and we are beginner friendly. If you have any interest in joining our ridiculously good-looking group of fun people, don't hesitate to contact LillieAnne, our President, at president@texastriathlon.org!
