title: Texas Undergraduate Research Journal
descriptionSnippet: The URJ produces an annual student produced journal that publishes research done by undergraduates at UT Austin. Additionally, the URJ hosts panels & workshops throughout the year to expose students to broad topics in research and research writing.
fullDescription: The Texas Undergraduate Research Journal (URJ) is responsible for publishing an annual academic journal with articles by Texas students who have engaged in independent research projects. We also organize various events throughout the academic year to promote student engagement with research on campus.
twitterDescription: The Texas Undergraduate Research Journal is a work of multi-disciplinary research produced and edited by University of Texas at Austin undergraduate students.

title: Texas Wake
descriptionSnippet: Texas Wake is the official Wakeboarding Team of UT. Texas Wake gives UT riders the chance to learn/further develop their wakeboarding skills and connect with great friends. We compete in collegiate level competitions nationwide. No experience necessary!
fullDescription: Texas Wake is the official Wakeboarding team of the University of Texas. It is a club in which UT wakeboarders and wakesurfers can connect and ride. We teach beginners as well as help experienced riders progress their skills. Texas Wake goes out on our boat multiple times a week for 4 hours each day, during which members can wakeboard or wakesurf. We have also recently set up a deal with Next Level Ride Cable Park, so every Texas Wake member gets a season pass, enabling them to wakeboard to their heart's content. We also compete (optional) at the collegiate level in various competitions nationwide. No experience necessary!

title: TexASHRAE
descriptionSnippet: ASHRAE is a building technology society that focuses on building systems, energy efficiency, indoor air quality and sustainability within the industry. ASHRAE's mission is to advance the arts and sciences of heating, ventilating, air conditioning and r...
fullDescription: ASHRAE is a building technology society that focuses on building systems, energy efficiency, indoor air quality and sustainability within the industry. ASHRAE's mission is to advance the arts and sciences of heating, ventilating, air conditioning and refrigerating to serve humanity and promote a sustainable world. Student Branch Members have the opportunity to widen their skills and advance their knowledge of the field, attend presentations, go on campus and facility tours, work on real-world projects, and network with area engineering professionals.
twitterDescription:

title: The Annette Strauss Institute For Civic Life
descriptionSnippet: The Annette Strauss Institute for Civic Life exists to cultivate informed voters and active citizens. We do so through research, education, and outreach programs focused on three key pillars: civic discovery, young people, and civil dialogue.

title: The Association of Black Psychologists
descriptionSnippet: Texas Student Circle of Association of Black Psychologists (ABPsi) mission is to promote professional development, Black Psychology and mental health awareness at The University of Texas at Austin.
fullDescription: Hello!
twitterDescription: We are Texas Student Circle of the Association of Black Psychologists. We meet bi-weekly on Thursday in UTC 1.104 at 5pm. Follow us for upcoming events!

title: The Center for Students in Recovery
descriptionSnippet: The Center for Students in Recovery (CSR) supports students recovering from addictions at the University of Texas at Austin.
fullDescription: The Center for Students in Recovery (CSR) supports students recovering from addictions at the University of Texas at Austin. We offer programming, resources, and activities that provide a pathway to both recovery and academic achievement. Since its founding in 2004, hundreds of students have turned to us for support. Our goal is to help students in recovery stay in recovery while enrolled here. We also welcome students curious about sobriety to explore, experience, and understand recovery at UT.
twitterDescription: The Center for Students in Recovery (CSR) provides a safe, healthy, and welcoming environment for students recovering from addiction.

title: The Language Campaign

title: The Latino Pan-Hellenic Council
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the Latino Pan-Hellenic Council is to act as a governing body, which serves to unify the Latino/a Fraternal Organizations. In addition to increase awareness, increase interest in and strengthen Latino/a community on campus....
fullDescription: The purpose of the Latino Pan-Hellenic Council is to act as a governing body, which serves to unify the Latino/a Fraternal Organizations. In addition to increase awareness, increase interest in and strengthen Latino/a community on campus.
twitterDescription: The Latino Pan-Hellenic Council was created by Greek-lettered organizations at UT Austin in 2000. Our mission is to unify the Greek Latino community.

title: The Longhorn Rocketry Association
descriptionSnippet: The Longhorn Rocketry Association is a student-run organization which designs, builds, and tests high-power rockets. We aim to provide hands-on experience with industry-standard design processes, fabrication techniques, and testing and launch procedures.
fullDescription: The Longhorn Rocketry Association is a student-run organization at the University of Texas which designs, builds, and tests high-power rockets. Through this, we aim to provide hands-on experience with industry-standard design processes, fabrication techniques, and testing and launch procedures.
twitterDescription: LRA (Longhorn Rocketry Association) is a student-run rocketry club at The University of Texas at Austin. We make rockets and rocket accessories.

title: The Onyx Honor Society
descriptionSnippet: Honor Society to recognize and inspire students of color at UT.
fullDescription: The mission of this organization is to inspire and recognize students of color at The University of Texas at Austin who strive for the advancement and inclusivity of the black community through academic excellence, leadership, and community engagement.
twitterDescription: Newly founded Black Honor Society on the campus of The University of Texas at Austin that champions Academic Excellence, Leadership and Community Engagement.

title: The Project
descriptionSnippet: The Project is a single-day service event open to the entire UT community. The event promotes connections between the UT and greater Austin communities through volunteering. Project 2020 will take place during February 2020.
fullDescription: Our goal is to provide an opportunity for the UT community to volunteer together, create an impact, and most importantly, provide a chance to connect with¬†underserved neighborhoods in Austin. By acting as a unified student body, we are able to share our overarching passion for service with the community we serve, resulting in a tangible impacts within the area and hearts we touch. The Project is UT's largest day of organized service in which approximately 15-20 different sites, each with unique activities, are assisted and beautified. Examples of the tasks we complete include are planting, mulching, painting buildings, painting murals, and building fences.
twitterDescription: Welcome to the official Twitter page of UT's largest day of service! Use #projectut on any tweets! Follow us on insta and facebook @theprojectut

title: The SOC
descriptionSnippet: The Student Organization serves as the front lines for the Student Activities area of the Office of the Dean of Students.

title: The Texas Orator
descriptionSnippet: The Texas Orator is a nonpartisan political review that was founded and is maintained by University of Texas students. We value thorough analysis in our publications and strive to protect free speech and unhindered access to information on campus.
fullDescription: The Texas Orator¬†is a nonpartisan, peer-reviewed political publication that was founded and is maintained by University of Texas students. We value thorough analysis in our publications and strive to protect the ideals of free speech and unhindered access to information on campus and nationwide. We seek to keep the student body informed of the implications of ever-changing political climates, both domestically and abroad, from a range of voices and perspectives.
twitterDescription: We are a nonpartisan, peer-reviewed political publication from the campus of @UTAustin. Look under "Contact" on our website for submissions.

title: The University of Texas at Austin: Pre-Law Division of The National Black Law Students Association/ Longhorn Chapter
descriptionSnippet: The chapter will allow undergraduate students interested in law school to get a first hand look at what it takes to get into law school, law school exam, prep courses, and even shadowing a law student. Pre-LAw NBLSA bridges the gap between the aspiring...
fullDescription: The purpose of the Pre-Law Division is to articulate and promote the educational, professional, political and social needs and goals of African American pre-law students. By implementing functions on the law school admission process and advocating for the community. Pre-Law NBLSA bridges the gap between the aspiring law student and the actual law student. This organization is open to all aspiring law students regardless of race, color, religion, sex or national origin.
twitterDescription: The University of Texas at Austin Pre-Law Division of The National Black Law Students Association| prelawnblsa@gmail.com

title: The University of Texas Elementary School
descriptionSnippet: We are a public charter that provides outstanding education for young East Austin students free of charge, while also training new educators from UT Austin and collaborating with our partner schools for the most positive outcomes for all students.
fullDescription:
The University of Texas Elementary School's Mission is:

(1)¬†To develop students into lifelong learners through rigorous, research-based curricula, individualized instruction, high expectations, and a nurturing environment that includes parental and community involvement;

(2)¬†To provide opportunities for professional development and outreach for The University of Texas at Austin‚Äôs academic units; and

(3)¬†To serve as a model of an exemplary educational program for diverse learners.

title: Theta Chi Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: The Delta Mu chapter of Theta Chi fraternity is comprised of gentleman who are not only leaders in the classroom but leaders in their communities and student organizations as well. Theta Chi strives to remain active on campus and the Austin community.
fullDescription: The purpose of Theta Chi is to give men at UT the opportunity to be a part of a truly life-changing experience by providing them with the tools to grow as a student, leader, and man. Theta Chi is not just another club, but an organization of men with the desire to build lifetime friendships and devote time to develop values. Theta Chi teaches, inspires, and empowers any member to be successful both inside and outside of the classroom and throughout their lives.

title: TX Votes
descriptionSnippet: To register students and educate them on voting and take a more active role in government.
fullDescription: TX Votes is a nonpartisan political student organization dedicated to creating more voters and better citizens. We promote voter registration and remind students to update their addresses, as well as educate on voter ID laws and elections. During off election cycles, we hold meetings to educate on public policy, discuss important issues in an open and judgment-free space, and encourage civil discourse.
twitterDescription: TX Votes is a nonpartisan organization at the University of Texas at Austin creating smarter voters and better citizens.

title: Umoja
descriptionSnippet: Umoja is a sister of women of color who has a mission to inspire other women of color at The University of Texas at Austin to be politically and socially pro-active, culturally responsible, resolute in empowering women, and apologetically beautiful.
fullDescription: Umoja has a mission to inspire women of color at The University of Texas at Austin to be politically and socially pro-active, culturally responsible, and resolute in empowering women.

title: Undergraduate Business Council
descriptionSnippet: By serving as the umbrella organization for the McCombs School of Business, the Undergraduate Business Council's mission is to help organize and unite the McCombs Affiliated Student Organizations to make a strong student body that supports its school.
fullDescription: The Undergraduate Business Council serves as a vital link between the students of the McCombs School of Business administration, faculty, and the professional world. Through student-led programs and activities, UBC educates and informs the McCombs student body about academic issues, professional topics, and general interests. By serving as the umbrella organization for McCombs, UBC's mission is to help organize and unite the McCombs Affiliated Student Organizations to make a strong student body that supports its school.
twitterDescription: Through our programs & activities, the Undergraduate Business Council is dedicated to creating a better environment for all BBAs as they work toward graduation.

title: Undergraduate Studies Council
descriptionSnippet: Undergraduate Studies Council (UGSC) is the official college council and student representative body of the School of Undergraduate Studies at the University of Texas at Austin. Through our actions, we empower the UGS community to explore all of UT.
fullDescription: Undergraduate Studies Council (UGSC), or UGS Council is the official college council in the Senate of College Councils and student representative body of the School of Undergraduate Studies at the University of Texas at Austin. Through our actions, we empower the UGS community to explore all of UT and help them find their place at the university, while fostering leadership skills needed to become leaders in any field they enter into.
twitterDescription: The School of Undergraduate Studies Council is the official representative student organization for the School of Undergraduate Studies.

title: United Muslim Relief Texas
descriptionSnippet: United Muslims Relief Texas aims to provide relief to those in the local community with a focus on building the future leaders of our community while improving ourselves in the service of others.
fullDescription: UMR Texas¬†utilizes a unique approach and relief, allowing young people to be involved in the transformative process of serving other from start to finish. We are a diverse group of students and volunteers who strive on a daily basis to implement targeted, cost-effective relief and development programs that improve lives. Our motto, "Development Through Service" bears a message of changing lives at both ends: those who need our help and those who want help from others.

title: University Filmmakers' Alliance
descriptionSnippet: UFA is open to all UT students and encourages them to create films with fellow students. Bi-weekly meetings with local film community guests, group filmmaking challenges, and movie screenings.
fullDescription: The University Filmmakers Alliance is a registered student organization at the University of Texas Austin. The organization is open to all UT students and encourages them to create films with fellow students. UFA was founded in 1997 when several Radio/Television/Film students felt they were not given enough experience by the department. Over the years, many students aspiring in film have met and created movies together, received internships or jobs, and have become acquinted with industry professionals.
twitterDescription: The oldest and largest film organization at the University of Texas; come check us out on Mondays at 7:00 in BUR 108M! #filmiswhatwedo

title: University Flying Club
descriptionSnippet: We are the University Flying Club, a group of people who share an interest in aviation and have a love for our beloved Longhorns!
fullDescription: Welcome to the University Flying Club! We're a group of aviation lovers based in the Austin area and provide a social atmosphere to all who are interested in flying. Throughout the school year we'll plan on having meetings, special guests and fly-outs. Join our email list and social media pages to learn more!

title: University Health Services
descriptionSnippet: University Health Services (UHS), located in the Student Services Building, is an on-campus healthcare facility just like your family doctor and more.
fullDescription: University Health Services is a¬†high quality, on-campus¬†healthcare facility.¬†UHS provides general medicine, urgent care, women‚Äôs health, sports medicine, physical therapy, nutrition services,¬†allergy shots, and immunization/ travel medicine¬†services, which are supported by in-house laboratory and radiology departments.

title: University Leadership Initiative
descriptionSnippet: We are an undocumented youth-led organization that advocates for the rights of the undocumented community at the local, state, and national levels focusing on education equity, DACA implementation, deportation defense, LGBTQ inclusion, and legislation.
fullDescription: University Leadership Initiative (ULI) is an Austin community and UT student organization composed of undocumented students and allies organizing around immigrant rights on the local, state, and national level and serves as a support system for undocumented members of the UT and Austin communities. ¬†We educate our community about their rights, fight and prevent deportations, bring resources to our community including free DACA forums and clinics, fight bad and uplift good legislation (especially in the Texas legislature), work with local schools to educate undocumented students and their educators about access to higher education, and, along with many other things, EMPOWER our members to stand up, fight back, and shape the future!
twitterDescription: Organization based out of UT-Austin that advocates for the liberation of the 11 million undocumented immigrants in the U.S. #HereToStay

title: University of Texas Sport Club Association
descriptionSnippet: The Sport Club program consists of sponsored student orgs that comprise the University of Texas Sport Club Association (UTSCA). Each club is formed, developed, governed and administered by the student membership of the club working with RecSports.
fullDescription: The Sport Club program consists of sponsored student organizations that comprise the University of Texas Sport Club Association (UTSCA). Each club offers students the opportunity to pursue a higher degree of participation with a group of individuals interested in the same level and type of sport. The UTSCA promotes student participation in a wide variety of physical and athletic activities, contributes to the development of student leadership and provides a bond between individual clubs.

title: University Theatre Guild
descriptionSnippet: University Theatre Guild serves as a creative outlet for theatre lovers of all experience levels who want to surround themselves with like-minded individuals. UTG is completely autonomous in its funding, management, and production
fullDescription:
The University Theatre Guild is the oldest student-run theatre organization at UT Austin that puts on plays for all to enjoy!

We put on at least two plays a semester with members participating in all aspects of production. This includes performing, directing, technical theatre, publicity, etc. We also have numerous social activities that allow our members to socialize with one another and have fun on the UT campus and around the greater Austin area.
twitterDescription: We are the official twitter for The University Theatre Guild ya IT Austin! Come join us for our weekly meeting in Parlin 103 every Wednesday at 7pm!

title: Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Team
descriptionSnippet: UAV Austin is a student-led technical and educational organization that specializes in both hardware and software engineering of fixed-wing, semi-autonomous, unmanned aerial systems. The mission of UAV Austin is the growth of its members into engineers.
fullDescription: UAV Austin is a student-led technical organization that specializes in fixed-wing unmanned aerial systems based at The University of Texas at Austin.
twitterDescription: The University of Texas UAV team gives its students hands-on experience and skills relevant to the current industry.

title: UT Dance Team
descriptionSnippet: As the official competitive dance team for the University of Texas at Austin, we work to represent our university with pride and grace at various public performances around Austin, as well as multiple dance competitions nationwide.
fullDescription: The UT Dance Team, also known as "Texas Dance," is the exclusively competitive dance team that represents UT Austin on a national level. We attend national competitions such as American Dance/Drill Team Nationals in Denton, TX and NDA Collegiate Championships in Daytona Beach, Florida. Our main goal as a team is to represent¬†UT with pride and grace¬†as we promote a healthy competitive spirit and a passion for dance.¬†We pride ourselves on being a student-run organization, and we work diligently towards¬†achieving a National Championship title.

title: UT Men's Ultimate Club
descriptionSnippet: We represent the University of Texas in the frisbee disc sport by playing in the top tournaments nationwide. Tuff, the A team, often finishes in the top 10 teams in the nation while Graze, the B team is consistently one of the best B teams in the nation.
fullDescription: Ultimate Frisbee, or utlimate for short, is a vastly growing sport nationwide. Our club has also been following this trend as we see more and more people at tryouts and membership numbers increase. For this reason, we have been able to expand our program to involve three teams:

title: UT Sailing Team
descriptionSnippet: The University of Texas Sailing Team is a nationally competitive club sport. Our goal is to expand the love and knowledge of competitive sailing throughout the University community and our district at large.
fullDescription: The University of Texas Sailing Team is the¬†nationally competitive club sport that travels across the U.S. to race against other colleges. We strive to compete at high levels while expanding the appreciation and love for sailboat racing throughout the University, our district, and the greater¬†national¬†sailing community.
twitterDescription: The University of Texas Sailing Team is a nationally competitive team that will teach you how to sail and compete.  Check us out!

title: UT Sciences Toastmasters Club
descriptionSnippet: This club helps people improve their public speaking and communication skills. The club hosts weekly meetings featuring speaking practice. This club is a chapter of Toastmasters International and is open to all students.
fullDescription: Official Toastmasters chapter for UT Austin students. UTSTM provides a welcoming and friendly environment for people of all backgrounds (undergrads, grad students, and non-students) to improve their public speaking and communications skills. "Friendship, diversity, and self-improvement" are the club's values. Come visit us to find out more about becoming a member.
twitterDescription: The official Twitter account of UT Sciences Toastmasters club! We are a student organization that promotes public speaking and communication skills.

title: UT Service Scholars
descriptionSnippet: UTSS enables students to enhance their leadership skills through a variety of service events and social seminars at the Longhorn Center for Community Engagement and across the great city of Austin.
fullDescription: The UT Service Scholars Program started as a collaboration between the Longhorn Center for Community Engagement and the LBJ School of Public Affairs. Scholars complete community service hours each semester while engaging in service-learning. Scholars choose where they serve while receiving guide towards a specific area in public service.

title: UT Student Organization Advisors

fullDescription: The Student Activities area of the Office of the Dean of Students has created several resources in order to help advisors in their work with registered student organizations. This group was created to assist with providing training, support, resources, and networking opportunities for UT faculty and staff that currently serve as an advisor for a student organization.

title: UT Women's Club Soccer
descriptionSnippet: Promote personal growth and skill development among student athletes.
fullDescription: The University of Texas Women's Club Soccer Team is an organization that is committed to promoting personal growth and skill development among student athletes. In order to achieve these goals, we provide both a competitive and supportive environment that allows our members to gain opportunitites and build relationships that enhance their college experience. Our members build the habit of demonstrating excellence in the classroom and on the field in their training and competition. Our success as an organization comes directly from the quality of experiences and the depth of relationships forme throughout the course of the season.

title: UT Women's Volleyball Club
descriptionSnippet: Texas Women's Club Volleyball allows dedicated women with an interest in the game to continue playing at a competitive level. UTWVC has consistently been ranked as one of the best clubs in the region and nation.
fullDescription: Texas Women‚Äôs Club Volleyball is a great way for women on campus to continue their love for the fast-growing sport. The UT RecSports affiliated organization is comprised of two teams. Both teams practice twice a week, for 3 hours each practice and actively participate in various fundraising, volunteer, and social events. As an organization, we pride ourselves on our highly competitive nature. Teams will travel to different cities and states to compete against the best teams in the nation. Every year UTWVC teams are national title-contending teams. Our mission is to promote the development of the sport of volleyball, while providing a fun, competitive environment.

title: Voices Against Violence
descriptionSnippet: Voices Against Violence (VAV) transforms the campus community by addressing interpersonal violence through dynamic programming that creates safety, cultivates support and promotes growth.
fullDescription: Voices Against Violence (VAV) Student Organization¬†is a collective of survivors and allies who are passionate about ending violence and creating a culture where consent and healthy relationships are valued on our campus. We strive to create a safer space to heal and thrive through our organization meetings, dynamic events, connections to resources, and peer education. We maintain an unwavering commitment to supporting survivors, ending interpersonal violence, increasing bystander intervention, and promoting social justice. We acknowledge the unique experiences of marginalized groups, recognize the intersections of oppression and interpersonal violence, and strive to ensure that our community is inclusive. VAV is open to all enrolled students at UT Austin.
twitterDescription: Voices Against Violence prevents interpersonal violence & supports survivors at UT Austin. VAV is a proud partner of @BeVocalUT. #UTGetsConsent

title: Women in Business Association
descriptionSnippet: Women in Business Association (WBA) strives to increase our members' knowledge of and involvement in the world of business by inviting educated and experienced women to speak and share advice with our organization. Members are encouraged to interact wi...
fullDescription: Women in Business Association (WBA) strives to increase members‚Äô knowledge of and involvement in the world of business in numerous ways. First, we invite educated and experienced women from a variety of different fields, including finance, accounting, management information systems, supply chain, technology, and more. Members are encouraged to interact with our invited speakers to promote rapport within our organization as well as gain an increased understanding of what it is like to have a business career. We also place a heavy emphasis on professional development through networking opportunities, technical workshops, and informative events that can help guide female undergraduates through the recruiting process. In addition, we focus on building personal connections between our members through unique social, fundraising, and community service events, so members can build a circle of friends and mentors. As a note, we are open to ALL majors, generally anybody who is interested in pursuing a career in business.

title: Women in Electrical and Computer Engineering (Women in ECE)
descriptionSnippet: Women in ECE fosters a community of engineering women within the Electrical and Computer Engineering department through social, academic, and professional opportunities.
fullDescription: The purpose of the women in ECE is to reach out and engage women from all levels in the department - from undergraduate to graduate to faculty. This group will foster a network within ECE that will serve professional, social, and academic purposes. Women in ECE is open to men and women.
twitterDescription: WECE fosters a community of engineering women within the Electrical & Computer Engineering department through social, academic, and professional opportunities

title: Women in Engineering Program
descriptionSnippet: The Women in Engineering Program (WEP) helps women in the Cockrell School get connected, develop as engineering leaders, and graduate with skills for life. WEP strives to recruit, retain and graduate more women from engineering.

title: Women in Foreign Affairs
descriptionSnippet: Women in Foreign Affairs is an organization that works to promote the role of women in various international fields, such as diplomacy, international business, and defense.
fullDescription: Women in Foreign Affairs is an organization that works to promote the role of women in various international fields, such as diplomacy, international business, and defense. The organization also encourages women to participate in global activism, NGO's, and other organizations. Women in Foreign Affairs hosts guest speakers to share their personal experiences in these areas. Speakers are invited to assist and advise women who are currently pursuing or are interested in having a career/internship in any of the fields mentioned above, or are looking to expand their knowledge in Foreign Affairs. Women in Foreign Affairs also has the goal of uniting students on campus with similar interests through socials designed to expand student networks and build relationships.
twitterDescription: Women in Foreign Affairs is a UT organization seeking to promote and expand the role of women in international relations and global activism!

title: Women in Gaming
descriptionSnippet: Women in Gaming is an organization devoted to empowering women, lgbtq+ and non-binary individuals in the gaming industry. WIG strives to provide a community for gamers through social and professional events.
fullDescription: Women in Gaming is an organization devoted to empowering women, lgbtq+ and non-binary individuals in the gaming industry. WIG strives to provide a community for gamers through social and professional events. By hosting casual gaming events and creating safe spaces for discourse, WIG is a welcoming place for gamers to grow, network and learn. We share opportunities, events and new technologies with our members to enrich their experience in gaming.

title: Women of Excellence
descriptionSnippet: The Women of Excellence was founded on four principles: mentorship, leadership, service, and diversity. The Women of Excellence seek to connect well established UT leaders with undergraduate freshmen.
fullDescription: Women of Excellence is an honorary organization that seeks to connect first and second year students with established female leaders at UT Austin. Founded on the tiers of diversity, leadership, mentorship, and service, Women of Excellence serves both the UT Austin community and Austin area as both reputable mentors and fervent leaders. Our fundamental principle is to foster the development of leadership through our prot√©g√©s (Buds) in order to promote the next generation of female leadership at our university.

title: Young Conservatives of Texas - University Chapter
descriptionSnippet: We as Young Conservatives of Texas, dedicate ourselves to the preservation of the American Dream and a strong and free America. YCT members are not Republicans or Democrats, but activists driven by belief in constitutionally conservative principles.
fullDescription: We as Young Conservatives of Texas, dedicate ourselves to the preservation of the American Dream and a strong and free America. YCT members are not Republicans or Democrats, but activists driven by belief in constitutionally conservative principles and seek to promote them in every interaction we have on campus with students, faculty, and our fellow citizens as a whole!

title: Zeta Psi Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: Zeta Psi prides itself on being an elite social fraternity on the UT campus and on the national stage. Our goals are to help men mature academically, socially, and professionally and to help them develop the skills necessary for success in life.
fullDescription: Zetes come together to have fun, enjoy life, get the most out of college, better ourselves and form lifelong bonds of brotherhood. Despite all the fun that college brings, the main reason you came to school is to get an education with the hopes of that translating to success in life. However, a great many of the things you need in life‚Äîto get by, have fun, and ultimately succeed ‚Äî aren‚Äôt taught in class. All our brothers can attest that you get more than the necessary knowledge, experience, and skill from Zeta Psi. Our goal, and the reason we exist, is to help you succeed by graduating with that edge you need in life, and have a really good time doing it. The result: better and more successful men with great memories, lifelong friends and the best experience you can have in college or beyond.
